dividus: <entryFree id="n14561" type="hapax" key="di_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>divido</etym>, <sense id="n14561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">separated</hi>: nosque ut sevorsum dividos leto offeres, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 25</bibl> (Trag. v. 118 Rib.: separatos, Non.).</sense></entryFree>
dividuus: <entryFree id="n14562" type="main" key="di_vi^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n14562.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Divisible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal et dissolubile et dividuum sit necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl>, praef. 8.—</sense><sense id="n14562.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Divided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separated</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">dividuom talentum faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 33</bibl>: munere, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi amne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a half-moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>with a parted trunk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor apium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividuum (me) tenent alter et alter amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14562.2" n="B" level="2"> In the later gramm.: dividuum nomen, quod a duobus vel amplioribus ad singulos habet relationem, vel ad plures in numeros pares distributos, ut <hi rend="ital">uterque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alteruter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quisque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singuli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bini</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terni</hi>, <hi rend="ital">centeni</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 581</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
divigena: <entryFree id="n14563" type="gloss" key="di_vi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeogenh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born of God</hi>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
divinatio: <entryFree id="n14564" type="main" key="di_vi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>divino</etym>. <sense id="n14564.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The faculty of foreseeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predicting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divination</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">mantikh/</foreign> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium, auspicium, vaticinium, praesagium, praedictio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 63, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 22, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes">16</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14564.1" n="II" level="1"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an examination</hi>, as to which of several accusers presenting themselves was <cb n="DIVI" /> the most proper to conduct the accusation. So the title of Cicero's oration against Caecilius: Divinatio in Caecilium; cf. Ascon. Argum.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:33" default="NO">7, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 1</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
divinator: <entryFree id="n14565" type="hapax" key="di_vi_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diviner</hi>, Firm. Math. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
divinatrix: <entryFree id="n14566" type="main" key="di_vi_na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>divinator</etym>, <sense id="n14566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that which divines; prophetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divining.</hi> —Adjectively: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divine: <entryFree id="n14567" type="main" key="di_vi_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. divinus <sense id="n14567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
divinipotens: <entryFree id="n14568" type="hapax" key="di_vi_ni^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>divinus</etym>, <sense id="n14568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mighty in divination</hi> (with saga), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
divinisciens: <entryFree id="n14569" type="hapax" key="di_vi_nisci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīni-scĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilled in divination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 290, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divinitas: <entryFree id="n14570" type="main" key="di_vi_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Godhead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divinity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14570.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 11 al.</bibl>—Of the deified Romulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of Augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14570.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14570.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The power of divining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 58, 59, § 149</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14570.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Divine quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence;</hi> of the orator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 86</bibl> (opp. humanitas); 2, 74; 89; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(memoriae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 1, 20</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinitates splendoresque astrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
divinitus: <entryFree id="n14571" type="main" key="di_vi_ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by divine providence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">influence</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n14571.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">divinitus latae suppetiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non partum per nos, sed divinitus ad nos delatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:199" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinitus accidere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut prodigio divinitus facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte quadam divinitus super ripas Tiberis effusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu quodam an divinitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seu forte seu divinitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia sit divinitus illis Ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 415</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14571.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14571.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">By divine communication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by inspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus hic homo'st, qui sciat divinitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 736</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 15, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and opp. conjectura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">inspirata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14571.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Divinely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admirably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi> (mostly Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">quae philosophi divinitus ferunt esse dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">loquitur Pompeius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille locus inductus a me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meriti homines de me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus humare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=148" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divino: <entryFree id="n14572" type="main" key="di_vi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>divinus, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n14572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to foresee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi> (class. cf. vaticino, praedico): <cit><quote lang="la">non equidem hoc divinavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil boni divinet animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mens sua sponte divinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 41</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">animo non divinante futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalitatem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 55, 56, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta collecta sunt ab Antipatro, quae mirabiliter a Socrate divinata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">divinatae opes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nux, 80</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego ea, quae facta sunt, divinabam futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinare, quid in castris obvenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 24</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus faciat eam, ut divinaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 42</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 694</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:52 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 52 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si de exitu divinaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestum praestare divinando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 16, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divinus: <entryFree id="n14573" type="main" key="di_vi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>divus</etym>, <sense id="n14573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine</hi> (class. and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n14573.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">divinae Matris imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1233" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 711</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 633</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergamum divina moenitum manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine ope divina bellum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi divino consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae divinis animatae mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina studia colere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos hominum esse divinos, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>of divine origin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: hoc divinum animal (homo, shortly before: quasi mortalem deum), id. <pb n="603" /> <cb n="DIVI" /> Fin. 2, 13, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis instinctus inflatusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causa divinior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">condimenta,</quote> <trans><tr>enjoyed by the gods</tr>, <tr>divine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor (Veneris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 403</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">decoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars Palladis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">divinissima dona, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>most worthy of a deity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: re divina facta, i. e., <hi rend="ital">religious exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine worship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense res divina is very freq.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epid. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 34</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl> et saep.; less freq. in the <number>plur.</number> divinae res, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> also in gen. for <hi rend="ital">religious affairs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Also verba, <hi rend="ital">a form of prayer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:14:3" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiones (opp. fides humana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14573.2" n="B" level="2"> Freq. connected with humanus as a stronger designation for <hi rend="ital">all things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">things of every kind</hi>, etc. (cf.: di hominesque under deus, I. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">dedunt se, divina humanaque omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 40</bibl></cit> et saep. But in the explanation of <hi rend="ital">philosophia</hi> by scientia divinarum humanarumque rerum, the term divinae res denotes <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physics</hi>, as distinguished from humanae res, i. e. <hi rend="ital">morals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 26, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:90" default="NO">90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:20 al" default="NO">20 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 35</bibl>.—So too in jurid. lang., divinae res signifies <hi rend="ital">natural laws</hi>, in opp. to humanae res, <hi rend="ital">positive laws</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, </sense><sense id="n14573.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The deity</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">to/ qei=on</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina si faverint,</quote> <trans><tr>God willing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14573.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The divine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which comes from God</hi>, nihil est divino divinius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14573.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which is under the sanction of a god;</hi> hence: quicquam divini credere alicui; or simply: divini alicui credere, <hi rend="ital">to believe one upon oath</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam edepol tu mihi divini quicquam creduis, in, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ei divini aut humani aequum est credere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam mihi divini numquam quisquam creduat, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n14573.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14573.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Divinely inspired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid praesagiens atque divinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus appropinquante morte multo est divinior, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille potius divinus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinarum sagacem flammarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:344" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divini quicquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also joined to humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 20</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of poets: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 400</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">divini pectoris carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 731</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina futuri Sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis imbrium imminentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophet</hi> = vates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:18:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 18, 11 al.</bibl>—In the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a prophetess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14573.8" n="B" level="2"> Like caelestis (but far more freq. in prose), <hi rend="ital">godlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superhuman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admirable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex maxime raro genere hominum et paene divino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio esse divino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni cujusdam civis et divini viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestes divinaeque legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus in supplicatione deneganda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: homo, Crispus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilis quaedam et divina virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admurmuratio senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia M. Tullii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas eloquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille nitor loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa ironia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 4:1:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in te, Sulpici, divina sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 29</bibl></cit> et saep.—In the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione nihil est in homine divinius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 3, 14</bibl>. Under the empire an epithet often bestowed on the emperors: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. Aug. 35, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 277</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">339</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīne</orth>.<cb n="DIVI" />  </sense><sense id="n14573.9" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">In a godlike manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through godlike power</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tu divine fac huc assis Sosia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14573.10" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) </sense><sense id="n14573.11" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">By divine inspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura divine praesensa et praedicta reperiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4</bibl>; and in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 5</bibl> Mos. —</sense><sense id="n14573.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In a godlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superhuman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admirable manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divinely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divine Plato escam malorum appellat voluptatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:62" default="NO">11, 1, 62</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
divise: <entryFree id="n14574" type="main" key="di_vi_se"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. divido, <sense id="n14574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
divisibilis: <entryFree id="n14575" type="main" key="di_vi_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>divido</etym>, <sense id="n14575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divisible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima (with dissolubilis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 14</bibl></cit>: non enim divisibilis et comprehensibilis est Deus, Hilar. in Matt. 9, 7.</sense></entryFree>
divisim: <entryFree id="n14576" type="main" key="di_vi_sim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. divido <sense id="n14576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
divisio: <entryFree id="n14577" type="main" key="di_vi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14577.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n14577.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si divisio fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:13:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae ac spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14577.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14577.4" n="1" level="3"> I. q. distributio, <hi rend="ital">partition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14577.5" n="b" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">an allotment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portion</hi> of food, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:122" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:23" default="NO">33, 1, 23</bibl>: POPVLO VIRITIM DIVISIONEM DEDIT, Inscr. Mommsen, 73; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3094</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4396</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14577.6" n="2" level="3"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">a violation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonoring</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14577.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Differences</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjects of dispute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa, quae divisiones multiplices ingerebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14577.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">logical</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rhetorical division</hi> (freq. in Cic. and Quint.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:63" default="NO">5, 10, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2" default="NO">2</bibl> cap. 6: De divisione, etc.</sense></entryFree>
divisor: <entryFree id="n14578" type="main" key="di_vi_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n14578.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A divider</hi>: divisor et disterminator mundi (axis), Ap. de Mundo, p. 57.—Esp., arithm. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a divisor</hi>, Boëth. Geom. 1, p. 1529 al.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n14578.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distributer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14578.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni inter filios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14578.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14578.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One who superintended the legal distributions to the tribes</hi>, Ps. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 1:8:22, p. 136" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 1, 8, 22, p. 136</bibl> Bait.—</sense><sense id="n14578.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A person hired by a candidate to bribe the electors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by distributing money among them</hi> (persons regarded as infamous), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 14:57" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 14, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl>; Cornel. Fragm. 1 (18, p. 450 ed. Orell.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 20, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 3</bibl>; cf. Smith's Antiq. p. 46, b.—</sense><sense id="n14578.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A judge</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 12, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
divisura: <entryFree id="n14579" type="main" key="di_vi_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>.—Prop., <sense id="n14579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division.</hi>—Concr., <hi rend="ital">the fork</hi> of a tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 122</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 106, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:48" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 21, § 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14579.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incision</hi>, e. g. in bleeding a person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:27" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:12:146 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 12, 146 sq.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in trees: laterum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divisus: <entryFree id="n14580" type="main" key="di_vi_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from divido.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14581" type="main" key="di_vi_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apportionment</hi> (very rare, and only in the <case>dat.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">quanta Macedonia esset, quam divisui facilis,</quote> <trans><tr>how easily divided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 54</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:40" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 40</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 56, 6</bibl>, the right reading is divisa).</sense></entryFree>
divitatio: <entryFree id="n14582" type="hapax" key="di_vi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dives</etym>, <sense id="n14582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enriching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus divitationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divitenses: <entryFree id="n14583" type="main" key="Divitenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Divitenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the town Divitia</hi> (the mod. <hi rend="ital">Deutz</hi>), opposite to Cologne, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1085</bibl> and 1086.</sense></entryFree>
divitia: <entryFree id="n14584" type="main" key="di_vi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. divitiae <sense id="n14584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
divitiacus: <entryFree id="n14585" type="main" key="Divitia^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Divitiăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n14585.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The brother of Dumnorix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief of the Aedui at the period of the Gallic war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and in alliance with the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl> sq.; 31 sq. al.— </sense><sense id="n14585.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Chief of the Suessiones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
divitiae: <entryFree id="n14586" type="main" key="di_vi^ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭtĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<sense id="n14586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sing. acc.</hi> divitiam, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 24</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dives</etym>, <hi rend="ital">riches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealth</hi> (cf.: opes, facultates, bona, fortunae, copiae, vis). </sense><sense id="n14586.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6</bibl> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 7</bibl> et saep.—Prov.: superare Crassum divitiis, <hi rend="ital">to be richer than Crassus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be very rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very fortunate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14586.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum inclutum divitiis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for its rich and costly presents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">demite divitias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rich</tr>, <tr>costly ornaments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:136" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palmyra urbs nobilis situ, divitiis soli, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>richness</tr>, <tr>fertility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 25, 21, § 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <cb n="DIVU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:690" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 690</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14586.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">richness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affluence</hi> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">in oratione Crassi divitias atque ornamenta ejus ingenii perspexi (perhaps alluding to the wealth of Crassus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu per jocum divitias orationis habere dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">verborum (with ubertas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divito: <entryFree id="n14587" type="main" key="di_vi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. dito <sense id="n14587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
divodurum: <entryFree id="n14588" type="main" key="Di_vo^du_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīvŏdūrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n14588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the</hi> Mediomatrici <hi rend="ital">in Gallia Belgica</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Metz</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 63</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
divolvo: <entryFree id="n14589" type="hapax" key="di_volvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-volvo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n14589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll to and fro.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ponder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa secum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divona: <entryFree id="n14590" type="main" key="Di_vo^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīvŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in the neighborhood of Bordeaux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a clear spring</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cahors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Urb. 14, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
divortium: <entryFree id="n14591" type="main" key="di_vorti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvortĭum</orth> (‡ <sense id="n14591.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">divertium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4859</bibl></cit>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>diverto</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a separation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14591.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illud quod volo habebo ab illo, facile invenio, quomodo divortium et discordiam inter nos parem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:66 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 66 sq.</bibl></cit> (with a play on II. 1 infra): <cit><quote lang="la">neutrubi habebo stabile stabulum, siquid divorti fuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14591.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n14591.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A divorce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolution of marriage</hi> (by consent; opp. repudium, compulsory divorce by either party; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:2:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 2, 2, § 1</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">orig. used only of the wife: uxori sit reddunda dos divortio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 31</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but afterwards in gen.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Lentulum cum Metella certe fecisse divortium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14591.4" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a point of separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place where a road divides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fork in a road</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 379</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">itinerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artissimo inter Europam Asiamque divortio Byzantium posuere Graeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 63</bibl></cit>.—So, aquarum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a summit whence the streams run different ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a water-shed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14591.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14591.6" n="1" level="3"> Ex communi sapientium jugo sunt doctrinarum facta divortia, etc., <hi rend="ital">divisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varieties</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14591.7" n="2" level="3"> Veris et hiemis, <hi rend="ital">the time at which winter ends and spring begins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14591.8" n="3" level="3"> Alta divortia riparum, <hi rend="ital">lofty opposite banks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14591.9" n="4" level="3"> Tanto rerum divortio, <hi rend="ital">opposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistency</hi>, Ap. de Mundo, p. 66, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">anima nullum init cum sua unitate divortium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divorto: <entryFree id="n14592" type="main" key="di_vorto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvorto</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dīvorsus</orth>, etc., v. diver-.</entryFree>
divulgatio: <entryFree id="n14593" type="main" key="di_vulga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvulgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>divulgo</etym>, <sense id="n14593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a publishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spreading abroad</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">litteraturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. Anim. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divulgo: <entryFree id="n14594" type="main" key="di_vulgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvulgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread among the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divulge</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">publico, vulgo, pervulgo, pervagor): librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">seria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: consilium Domitii, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chirographa omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versiculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem mimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid turpi fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem tam gloriosae expeditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc opinionem in Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.— With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est divulgandum de te jam esse perfectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14594.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make common</hi>: cujus primum tempus aetatis palam fuisset ad omnium libidines divulgatum, <hi rend="ital">lowered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">degraded to</hi>, Cic. Post. Red. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 5, 11</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvul-gātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">widespread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus divulgata gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divulgata veris ante habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Afer divulgato ingenio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus levissimus et divulgatissimus (sc. praeturae),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>most common</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
divulsio: <entryFree id="n14595" type="main" key="di_vulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvulsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>divello</etym>, <sense id="n14595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separating</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 117</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima familiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divulsus: <entryFree id="n14596" type="main" key="di_vulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from divello.</entryFree>
divum: <entryFree id="n14597" type="main" key="di_vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. divus, B.</entryFree>
divus: <entryFree id="n14598" type="main" key="di_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, (without the digamma) <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">di=os</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n14598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14598.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (mostly archaic and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). As an <pos>adj.</pos> very rarely: res <pb n="604" /> <cb n="DO" /> divas edicit, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 197, 15</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">diva caro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 76</bibl></cit>: DIUM fulgur appellabant diurnum, quod putabant Jovis, ut nocturnum Summani, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75, 14</bibl> Müll.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n14598.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dīus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīva</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dia</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14598.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvus</orth>: si divus, si diva, esset, etc., a precatory formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 29, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is divus (sc. Apollo) exstinguet perduelles vestros, Carm. Marcii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 25, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dive, quem proles Niobea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalin' decuit violari vulnere divum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 797</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam me divi adaxint ad suspendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 387</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 363</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 38 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 176</bibl> et saep.: divumque hominumque pater, rex, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 65</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 648</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">divom atque hominum clamat fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro divum fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">more rarely, divorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(munera) digna diva venustissima Venere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turni sic est affata sororem Diva deam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Juno</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 139</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 447</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">482: Diva Bona for Bona Dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:148" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 148</bibl></cit>: divos scelerare parentes, <hi rend="ital">the family gods</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">qeoi/ patrw=oi</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 404</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14598.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīus</orth>: Dii Indigetes Diique Manes, a precatory formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl>: Dia Dearum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 22, ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">DEA DIA,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ceres</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 961</bibl></cit> and 1499: Venus pulcherrima dium, Enn. ap. Prob. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14598.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14598.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Godlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine</hi>, an epithet applied to any thing deified or of extraordinary excellence or distinction: <cit><quote lang="la">urbi Romae divae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sarcastically: est ergo flamen, ut Jovi, etc., sic divo Julio M. Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: Romule die, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl> (Ann. v. 115, ed. Vahl.): Ilia dia nepos, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=286:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 286, 16</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 56, ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">dia Camilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 657</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dias in luminis oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1389</bibl></cit>: profundum (cf. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ls di=a</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 537</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia Catonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 31</bibl></cit> et saep.—After the Aug. period divus became a frequent <hi rend="ital">epithet for the deceased Roman emperors</hi> in the historians, and on coins and inscriptions, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14598.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the sky</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 65</bibl> Müll.—Esp. freq., sub divo, like sub Jove, <hi rend="ital">under the open sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the open air</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> Varr. L. L. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 23</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub divum rapiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
do: <entryFree id="n14599" type="main" key="do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">do</orth>, <itype>dĕdi, dătum, dăre</itype> (also in a longer form, dănunt = dant, Pac., Naev., and Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 14 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 1</bibl> et saep.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68, 12</bibl> Müll.—<sense id="n14599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duim = dem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas = des,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 12</bibl>; an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 23</bibl>; an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 34 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Imper.</hi>: DVITOR, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ex conject.—Inf.</hi>: DASI = dari, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68, 13</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dane = dasne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—The <hi rend="ital">pres. pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first pers.</hi>, dor, does not occur), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. dā, da-dā-mi, give; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di/-dw-mi, dwth/r, do/sis</foreign>; cf.: dos, donum, damnum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to give;</hi> and hence, with the greatest variety of application, passing over into the senses of its compounds, derivatives, and synonyms (edere, tradere, dedere; reddere, donare, largiri, concedere, exhibere, porrigere, praestare, impertire, suppeditare, ministrare, subministrare, praebere, tribuere, offerre, etc.), as, <hi rend="ital">to give away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit; give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign; bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford; offer</hi>, etc. (very freq.).</sense><sense id="n14599.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">eam carnem victoribus danunt, Naev. ap. Non. l. l.: ea dona, quae illic Amphitruoni sunt data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 138</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patera, quae dono mi illic data'st,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dandis recipiendisque meritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut par sit ratio acceptorum et datorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 58</bibl></cit>: ut obsides accipere non dare consuerint, Caes. B. G. <cb n="DO" /> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 31, 7 et saep.: patriam (sc. mundum) dii nobis communem secum dederunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominibus animus datus est ex illis sempiternis ignibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea dant magistratus magis, quae etiamsi nolint, danda sint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">imperia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuria, ad summum usum urbis fabris tignariis data,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgus agros locupletium plebi, ut servitio, colendos dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei filiam suam in matrimonium dat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras ad te numquam habui cui darem, quin dederim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 19</bibl></cit>: litteras (ad aliquem), <hi rend="ital">to write to one</hi>, saep.;
