cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the same signif.: aliquid ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras alicui, said of the writer,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one a letter to deliver</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the bearer, rarely,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver a letter to one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: colloquium dare, <hi rend="ital">to join in a conference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converse</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 598</bibl> (Lachm.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. videmus): colloquiumque sua fretus ab urbe dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>parley</tr>, <tr>challenge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:10:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare poenas,</quote> <trans><tr>to give satisfaction</tr>, <tr>to suffer punishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui poenas dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to make atonement to any one; to suffer for any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 544</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 31</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. poena: decus sibi datum esse justitia regis existimabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam me quodammodo invitas et tui spem das,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabant hae feriae tibi opportunam sane facultatem ad explicandas tuas litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ansas alicui ad reprehendendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas causas suspicionum offensionumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatem per provinciam itineris faciundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: iter alicui per provinciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicam libertatem populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus alicui, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se fidem et jusjurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <trans><tr>to bestow labor and pains on any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam virtuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 84</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: operam, ne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam amicitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela (ventis),</quote> <trans><tr>to set sail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra vela dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to steer towards the right</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> 3, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me librum L. Cossinio ad te perferendum dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin homo amens diripiendam urbem daturus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: ita dat se res, <hi rend="ital">so it is circumstanced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so it is</hi>, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prout tempus ac res se daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: sic datur, <hi rend="ital">so it goes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such is fate</hi>, i. e. you have your reward, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 6, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> sometimes (mostly in poets) <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dăta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">gifts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 6</bibl> (4, 14, 6 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 363</bibl> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 24, 66</bibl>, where dona data belong together, as in the archaic formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">DATVM DONVM DVIT, P. R. Q.).— Prov.: dantur opes nulli nunc nisi divitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:81:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 81, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dat census honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:217" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14599.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">da mihi frui perpetuā virginitate,</quote> <trans><tr>allow me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 486</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:350" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 350</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di tibi dent captā classem reducere Trojā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 191</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 323</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14599.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">da, femina ne sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 202</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14599.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14599.5" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n14599.6" n="1" level="3"> Nomina, <hi rend="ital">to enroll one's self for military service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enlist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 10</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">transf. beyond the military sphere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14599.7" n="2" level="3"> Manus (lit., as a prisoner of war, to stretch forth the hands to be fettered; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence),</quote> <trans><tr>to yield</tr>, <tr>surrender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and more freq. transf. beyond the milit. sphere,</quote> <trans><tr>to yield</tr>, <tr>acquiesce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:688" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 688</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 568</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:1 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14599.8" n="3" level="3"> Terga, for the usual vertere terga; v. tergum.—</sense><sense id="n14599.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14599.10" n="1" level="3"> Esp. in jurid. lang.: DO, DICO, ADDICO, the words employed by the praetor in the execution of his office; viz. DO in the granting of judges, actions, exceptions, etc.; DICO in pronouncing sentence of judgment; ADDICO in adjudging the property in dispute to one or the other party; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 30</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence called tria verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14599.11" n="2" level="3"> Datur, <hi rend="ital">it is permitted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">granted;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> clause: quaesitis diu <cb n="DO" /> terris, ubi sistere detur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 307</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim tamen recedere sensim datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:127" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo intellegi datur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 20, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14599.12" n="C" level="2"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">to grant</hi> a proposition: <cit><quote lang="la">in geometria prima si dederis, danda sunt omnia: dato hoc, dandum erit illud (followed by concede, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14599.13" n="D" level="2"> Designating the limit, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi> somewhere; and with se, <hi rend="ital">to betake one's self</hi> somewhere: <cit><quote lang="la">tum genu ad terram dabo,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me haec deambulatio ad languorem dedit!</quote> <trans><tr>has fatigued me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc mihi in manum dat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitem me in pistrinum dabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem in conspectum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring to view</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in vincula,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast into prison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma in profluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem usque Sicanium fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem leto,</quote> <trans><tr>to put to death</tr>, <tr>to kill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in viam,</quote> <trans><tr>to set out on a journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socrates, quam se cumque in partem dedisset, omnium fuit facile princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 60</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14599.14" n="E" level="2"> Designating the effect, <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dederit damnum aut malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec consulto alteri damnum dari sine dolo malo potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Tull. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 39</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">malum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quī occultari facilius credas dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inania duro vulnera dat ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">motus dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to impart motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:819 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 819 al.</bibl></cit> (but motus dare, to make motion, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be moved</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 311</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">stragem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum ruinas,</quote> <trans><tr>to overthrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1329</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora tristitiae dissolvenda dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>caused to be delivered from sadness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 40</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: dant animos vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 242</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14599.15" n="F" level="1"> Aliquid alicui, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">for the sake of</hi> another; <hi rend="ital">to please</hi> or <hi rend="ital">humor</hi> another; <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi> any thing to another (for the more usual condonare): da hoc illi mortuae, da ceteris amicis ac familiaribus, da patriae, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: aliquid auribus alicujus, Trebon. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caere hospitio Vestalium cultisque diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus stomacho quam consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 117</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut concessisti illum senatui, sic da hunc populo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>forgive him</tr>, <tr>for the sake of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabat et famae, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n14599.16" n="b" level="4"> Se alicui, <hi rend="ital">to give one's self up wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to devote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedicate one's self</hi> to a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedit se etiam regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 10</bibl>; Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi si large volantis ungula se det equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv, 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 71 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mosel. 5, 448</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se et hominibus Pythagoreis et studiis illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sermonibus vulgi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se jucunditati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se populo ac coronae,</quote> <trans><tr>to present one's self</tr>, <tr>appear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">si se dant (judices) et sua sponte quo impellimus inclinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14599.17" n="G" level="1"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">communicate</hi> (like accipere, for to learn, to hear, v. accipio, II.; mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">erili filio hanc fabricam dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ob rem has partes didicerim, paucis dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imo etiam dabo, quo magis credas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da mihi nunc, satisne probas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessalici da bella ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:219" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is datus erat locus colloquio,</quote> <trans><tr>appointed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fixa canens ... Saepe dedit sedem notas mutantibus urbes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>foretold</tr>, <tr>promised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 107</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> i. q.: narratur, dicitur, fertur, etc., <hi rend="ital">is said</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu pius Aeneas eripuisse datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:434" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 434</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:315" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 315</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 337</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14599.18" n="H" level="1"> Fabulam, <hi rend="ital">to exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce a play</hi> (said of the author; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">docere fabulam, agere fabulam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. prol. 1</bibl> Don.; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: dare foras librum = edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14599.19" n="I" level="1"> Verba (alicui), <hi rend="ital">to give</hi> <pb n="605" /> <cb n="DOCE" /> <hi rend="ital">empty words</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 6</bibl> Ruhnk.; Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl> A.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:45" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:76" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 76</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14599.20" n="K" level="1"> Alicui aliquid (laudi, crimini, vitio, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to impute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi> a thing to any one, as a merit, a crime, a fault, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quam rem vitio dent, quaeso animum attendite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vitio datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiā criminum summam laudem Sex. Roscio vitio et culpae dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14599.21" n="L" level="1"> Alicui cenam, epulas, etc., <hi rend="ital">to give one a dinner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertain at table</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui cenam parasitis dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandium dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14599.22" n="M" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, in gen. (rare, but freq. as <hi rend="ital">impers.;</hi> v. B. 2. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">dari sibi diem postulabat,</quote> <trans><tr>a respite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14600" type="main" key="do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">-do</orth>, -dāre (<sense id="n14600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obsol.</hi>, found only in the compounds, abdo, condo, abscondo, indo, etc.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root dhā-, da-dhāmi, set, put, place; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qe-, ti/qhmi</foreign>; Ger. thun, thue, that; Eng. do, deed, etc.</etym>. This root is distinct from 1. do, Sanscr. dā, in most of the Arian langg.; cf. Pott. Etym. Forsch. 2, 484; Corss. Ausspr. 2, 410; <cit><quote lang="la">but in Italy the two seem to have been confounded, at least in compounds,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 254 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 254 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. Max Müller, Science of Lang. Ser. 2, p. 220, N. Y. ed.; Fick, Vergl. Wört. p. 100.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14601" type="main" key="do3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">do</orth>, <case>acc.</case> of domus, v. domus <sense id="n14601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
doceo: <entryFree id="n14602" type="main" key="do^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root da; Zend. dā, to know; strengthened, dak-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dida/skw</foreign>; Lat. disco</etym>, <sense id="n14602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to teach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, etc. (for syn. cf.: edoceo, perdoceo, erudio, praecipio, instituo). </sense><sense id="n14602.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., with double <case>acc.</case> of person and thing: <cit><quote lang="la">pejor magister te istaec docuit ... illa, quae te docui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc hominem cursuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ejusmodi rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 25, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros elementa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is reliqua frustra docetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:11" default="NO">1, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:70" default="NO">3, 8, 70</bibl>; 6, 2, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 76</bibl> et saep.; cf.: doctus dogmam, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> P.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">doctus militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:40, p. 224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 40, p. 224</bibl></cit> ed. Gerl.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">docemur auctoritate domitas habere libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 57, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docemur disputare, non vivere (= discimus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi variare gyros docentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 6</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut doceam Rullum posthac in iis saltem tacere rebus, in quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 30 al.</bibl>; cf. ellipt. with <case>abl.</case> of instrument: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratem fidibus (sc. canere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem docendum curare equo, armisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; Zumpt, § 391 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to instruct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inform one of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ejus injuriis judices docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">44, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 3 al.</bibl> —With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doceant eum, qui vir Sex. Roscius fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:20 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 20 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosos discendi erudiunt atque docent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 1</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepit studiose omnia Docere, educare, ita uti si esset filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:137" default="NO">9, 4, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 306</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quod de lacu Albano docuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>; so with two <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 198</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">docui per litteras, id nec opus esse nec fieri posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 63</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum doceo et explano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:2" default="NO">3, 5, 2</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Tyrannio docet apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n14602.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: fabulam, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dida/skein</foreign>, qs. to teach a play to the actors, <hi rend="ital">to rehearse;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to produce, exhibit</hi> <cb n="DOCI" /> <hi rend="ital">on the stage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor fuit aliquanto is, qui primus fabulam dedit, quam ii, qui multas docuerant (Plautus et Naevius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:29:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 29, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:42" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 42</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">doctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi> in any thing (cf.: litteratus, eruditus, peritus, gnarus, scitus).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctus vir et Graecis litteris eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 30, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 74, 299</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentes humanissimi et doctissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit enim doctus ex disciplina Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 25</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">docti et Graecis litteris et Latinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">45</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:76" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 76</bibl>. —With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minus Graece quam Latine doctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fandi doctissima Cymodocea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum atque morum populi Romani jurisque civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis lanificae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 381</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Maecenas) docte sermones utriusque linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces modos (with citharae sciens),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:692" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctus sagittas tendere Sericas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Sec. 75</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad delinquendum doctior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:256" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parum fausto carmine docta fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sapphica puella Musa doctior,</quote> <trans><tr>more skilled in song</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docta puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:11:6" default="NO">2, 11, 6</bibl> (3, 2, 6 M.); <cit><quote lang="la">2, 13, 11 (3, 4, 11 M.).—Esp. as epithet of Catullus by other poets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verona docti syllabas amat vatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:61:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 61, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 181</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: doctus, <hi rend="ital">the man of skill.—Prov.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctus in se semper divitias habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; but class. only in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">doctī</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the learned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctorum est ista consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14602.3" n="2" level="3"> Of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">frontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 28, 16 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces Pythagoreorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prece,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus artificis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:832" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 832</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 792</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:19:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 19, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 12, 12 M.) et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14602.4" n="B" level="2"> In Plaut. and Ter., <hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum, callidum, doctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 24</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 21</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, dolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:70 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 70 al.</bibl>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">docte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14602.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Learnedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.).— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:46" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 46</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14602.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cunningly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleverly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">docte et sapienter dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docte tibi illam perdoctam dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docte sapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 162</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 21</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dochlea: <entryFree id="n14603" type="main" key="dochle^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dochlĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> chamaepitys, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 26, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dochmius: <entryFree id="n14604" type="greek" key="dochmi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dochmĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">do/xmios</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">pou/s</foreign>), <sense id="n14604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dochmiac foot in poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose fundamental scheme is</hi> ˘ <cit><quote lang="la">[macracute] [macracute] ˘ [macracute],</quote> <trans><tr>of which</tr>, <tr>however</tr>, <tr>about thirty modifications are described</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:79 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 79 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
docibilis: <entryFree id="n14605" type="main" key="do^ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>doceo</etym>, <sense id="n14605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that learns easily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teachable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mon. 12 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 47, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docibiles Dei,</quote> <trans><tr>disciples of God</tr>, <tr>taught by God</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 6, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
docibilitas: <entryFree id="n14606" type="gloss" key="do^ci^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aptness in learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">docility</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Sent. 5, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
docilis: <entryFree id="n14607" type="main" key="do^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>doceo</etym>, <sense id="n14607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily taught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">docile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14607.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (freq. and class.).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua docilis et humanis moribus assueta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Sec. 45</bibl> et saep.; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:24" default="NO">4, 2, 24</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad agriculturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:31:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 31, 16</bibl>; in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 56</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebant luscinias Graeco atque Latino sermone docilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 59, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes imitandis turpibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 40</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallendi,</quote> <trans><tr>skilful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:233" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freni (equus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:360" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 360</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerva accedere mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14607.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of things: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et bibula chrysocolla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cb n="DOCU" /> hasta relegi et relinqui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:237" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 237</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor pascere rumorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with docility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teachably</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 401</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
docilitas: <entryFree id="n14608" type="main" key="do^ci^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>docilis</etym>, <sense id="n14608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aptness for being taught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">docility.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14608.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:157" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 42, 64, § 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes fere artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14608.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a moral sense, <hi rend="ital">gentleness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
docimen: <entryFree id="n14609" type="main" key="do^ci^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcĭmen</orth>, v. documen.</entryFree>
docis: <entryFree id="n14610" type="greek" key="do^cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">doki/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fiery meteor</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 58, 23.</sense></entryFree>
docte: <entryFree id="n14611" type="main" key="docte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">docte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. doceo, <sense id="n14611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
docticanus: <entryFree id="n14612" type="main" key="docti^ca^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctĭcănus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>doctus-cano</etym>, <sense id="n14612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">singing skilfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
doctificus: <entryFree id="n14613" type="main" key="docti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>doctus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n14613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making learned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ardor (i. e. Pallas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, § 567</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
doctiloquus: <entryFree id="n14614" type="main" key="docti^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>doctus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n14614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking learnedly</hi> (ante- and postclass.): oratores, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 41</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 568, ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 903</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
doctisonus: <entryFree id="n14615" type="main" key="docti^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctĭ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>doctus</etym>, <sense id="n14615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilfully sounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 180</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
doctiuscule: <entryFree id="n14616" type="hapax" key="docti^uscu^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctĭuscŭle</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pedantically</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
doctor: <entryFree id="n14617" type="main" key="doctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>doceo</etym>, <sense id="n14617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instructor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 33, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:22:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 22, 35</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
doctrina: <entryFree id="n14618" type="main" key="doctri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>doctor</etym>, <sense id="n14618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">teaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruction</hi> (class.; cf.: litterae, artes, disciplina, praecepta, scientia, humanitas). </sense><sense id="n14618.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliqua mihi doctrina tradita, sed in rerum usu causisque tractata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 208</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:44:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 44, 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:12" default="NO">6, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:1" default="NO">12, 2, 1</bibl> (in these passages of Quint. opp. natura; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 100</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 33</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14618.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14618.3" n="A" level="2"> Object., the knowledge imparted by teaching, i. e. <hi rend="ital">science</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erudition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est unum perfugium doctrina ac litterae, quibus semper usi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 89</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: nonnulli litteris ac studiis doctrinae dediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; and with the latter cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis studiis malisque doctrinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piso Graecis doctrinis eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad domesticum morem adventiciam doctrinam adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me omnis ars et doctrina liberalis et maxime philosophia delectavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rhetoric</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor doctrinae ejus (sc. Numae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina deos spernens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 40</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14618.4" n="B" level="2"> Subject., the habit produced by instruction, <hi rend="ital">principle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala studia malaeque doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id fecit naturā solum, sed etiam doctrinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 17, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
doctrinalis: <entryFree id="n14619" type="main" key="doctri_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctrīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>doctrina</etym>, <sense id="n14619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">theoretical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 24, 14</bibl></cit>; Cassiod. Inst. Lib. Litt. praef.</sense></entryFree>
doctrix: <entryFree id="n14620" type="main" key="doctrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>doctor</etym>, <sense id="n14620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who instructs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instructress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sapientia) doctrix est disciplinae Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> de Mor. Eccl. Cath. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 159</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1122</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
doctus: <entryFree id="n14621" type="main" key="doctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">doctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from doceo.</entryFree>
documen: <entryFree id="n14622" type="main" key="do^cu^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcŭmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dŏcĭmen</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. documentum <sense id="n14622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
documentatio: <entryFree id="n14623" type="gloss" key="do^cu^menta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcŭmentātĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">nouqesi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n14623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reminding</hi>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
documentum: <entryFree id="n14624" type="main" key="do^cu^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏcŭmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (dŏcŭmen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 392</bibl>; <sense id="n14624.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and dŏcĭmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2425" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2425</bibl></cit> P.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>doceo: <cit><quote lang="la">documenta quae exempla docendi causa dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 62</bibl></cit> Müll.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a lesson</hi>, <hi rend="ital">example</hi> (either for instruction or warning); <hi rend="ital">a pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warning; a proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specimen</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n14624.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Rutilius documentum fuit hominibus nostris virtutis, antiquitatis, prudentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanorum casuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 40</bibl></cit>, <pb n="606" /> <cb n="DODR" /> 6: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae dare, 45, 37: patientiae dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii mei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavendae similis injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa egregii principis dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:42" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum rerum maxuma documenta haec habeo quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis exempli, Liv. praef. § 10: esse documentum adversus aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:9:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 46, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis ego documenti in omnes casus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:30:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus rei esse documento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14624.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interrog. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dederas enim, quam contemneres populares insanias, jam inde ab adolescentia documenta maxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">documentum capere, quid esset victis extimescendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeat me ipsum sibi documento, quae vitae via facillime viros bonos ad honorem perducat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in bello fortuna posset, esse documento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se documento futurum utrum ... an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud sane, cur ad majora tibi fidamus, documenti quicquam dedisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Cato) esset hominibus documento, ea quoque percipi posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14624.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis documentum dabo, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">documentum esse, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">documento esse, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris, ut parcius instarent, fuere documentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14624.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulis effossis oculis domum remittit, ut sint reliquis documento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:4 al" default="NO">11, 3, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infidus socius ... ad Fabiorum Pyrrhive proditorem tertium transfugis documentum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitate deum erga bona malaque documenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dodecaeteris: <entryFree id="n14625" type="main" key="do_de^ca^e^te_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdĕcăĕtēris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dwdekaethri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of twelve years</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 18, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dodecatemorion: <entryFree id="n14626" type="greek" key="do_de^ca^te_mo^ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdĕcătēmŏrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dwdekathmo/rion</foreign>, in astronomy, <sense id="n14626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the twelfth part of a constellation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 694</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">699 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dodecatheon: <entryFree id="n14627" type="greek" key="do_de^ca^the^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdĕcăthĕon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dwdeka/qeon</foreign>, <sense id="n14627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called after the twelve greater gods;</hi> perh. Primula vulg., Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 9, § 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dodona: <entryFree id="n14628" type="main" key="do_do_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 228</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 117</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dwdw/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n14628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Epirus</hi>, famed on account of its very ancient oracle of Jupiter, situated in an oak-grove, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 95</bibl>; Plin. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl> (3, 14, 3 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 43</bibl>;
