<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:426 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 426 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14628.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14628.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The sacred oak-grove of Dodona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 149</bibl> Serv.—</sense><sense id="n14628.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Dodonean priests</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14628.4" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n14628.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōdō-naeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Dodona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Dodonean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 623</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lebetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Bell. Get. 136 al.</bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n14628.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōdōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Dodona</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14628.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōdōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Dodonean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 716</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:32" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thyene,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>one of the Hyades</tr>, <tr>as the nurses of Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:711" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 711</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">these latter are called Dodonides Nymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 182" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14628.8" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dō-dōnĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>nations living on acorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dodra: <entryFree id="n14629" type="main" key="do_dra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dodrans</etym>, <sense id="n14629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink composed of nine ingredients</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 86</bibl> and 87; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: * dodralis potio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 86</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dodralis: <entryFree id="n14630" type="main" key="do_dra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n14630.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr></sense></entryFree>
dodrans: <entryFree id="n14631" type="main" key="do_drans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nine twelfths</hi> or <hi rend="ital">three fourths</hi> of any thing (v. as, I.). </sense><sense id="n14631.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus aedificii reliquum dodrantem emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere dodrantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres ex dodrante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dodrantes semuncias horarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 14, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondo dodrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 45" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 45</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14631.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n14631.3" n="(a)" level="5"> As a measure of length, <hi rend="ital">nine inches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 9, 14, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 65" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 65</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14631.4" n="(b)" level="5"> As a measure of time, <hi rend="ital">three quarters of an hour</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 58, § 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 14, 11, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dodrantalis: <entryFree id="n14632" type="main" key="do_dranta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdrantālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dodrans</etym>, <sense id="n14632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of nine</hi> <cb n="DOLE" /> <hi rend="ital">inches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:44" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dodrantarius: <entryFree id="n14633" type="main" key="do_dranta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōdrantārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> dodrans: tabulae, <hi rend="ital">the debtbooks introduced in consequence of the</hi> lex Valeria feneratoria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:Fragm. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. Fragm. 2</bibl> Niebuhr.</sense></entryFree>
doga: <entryFree id="n14634" type="greek" key="do^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">doxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n14634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of vessel</hi> (perhaps a measure), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 48</bibl>; cf. doga <foreign lang="greek">bou/tths</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
dogarius: <entryFree id="n14635" type="gloss" key="dogarius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dogarius</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">bouttopoio/s</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
dogma: <entryFree id="n14636" type="greek" key="dogma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dogma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also <sense id="n14636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: Pythagoream dogmam doctus, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> P.), = <foreign lang="greek">do/gma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a philosophic tenet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doctrine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dogma</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 13, 4 al.</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 27</bibl>, written as Greek). —</sense><sense id="n14636.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">crudele regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 16, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dogmaticus: <entryFree id="n14637" type="greek" key="dogma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dogmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dogmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a philosophic doctrine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dogmatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 17, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dogmatistes: <entryFree id="n14638" type="greek" key="dogma^tistes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dogmătistes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dogmatisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who maintains dogmata</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dogmatist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 2</bibl> Invect. in Hier. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 25.</sense></entryFree>
dogmatizo: <entryFree id="n14639" type="main" key="dogma^ti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dogmătīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dogmati/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n14639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to propound a dogma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 57:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 57, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dolabella: <entryFree id="n14640" type="main" key="do^la_bella1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlābella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dolabra</etym>, <sense id="n14640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small pick-axe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hatchet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:24:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 24, 4 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14641" type="main" key="Do^la_bella2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlābella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n14641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. pr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman family in the</hi> gens Cornelia, <hi rend="ital">of which the best-known individual is</hi> P. Cornelius Dolabella, <hi rend="ital">Cicero's son-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlābel-lĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <trans><tr>named after a Dolabella otherwise unknown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO">12, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolabra: <entryFree id="n14642" type="main" key="do^la_bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlābra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dolo</etym>, <sense id="n14642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mattock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pickaxe</hi>, as a milit. implement, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5" default="NO">9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:248" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 248</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">an agricultural implement,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 21, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">a butcher's implement,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. s. v. SCENA, p. 318, 18 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
dolabrarius: <entryFree id="n14643" type="gloss" key="do^la_bra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlābrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dolabra</etym>, <sense id="n14643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pickaxe-maker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4071</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4081</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolabratus: <entryFree id="n14644" type="main" key="do^la_bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlābrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mattockshaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">securis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 3</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 2</bibl>, read delibratis).</sense></entryFree>
dolamen: <entryFree id="n14645" type="hapax" key="do^la_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dolo</etym>, <sense id="n14645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hewing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dolatilis: <entryFree id="n14646" type="hapax" key="do^la_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily hewn</hi>: lapides, Auct. de Lim. ap. Goes. p. 270.</sense></entryFree>
dolatorium: <entryFree id="n14647" type="hapax" key="do^la_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an implement for hewing stones;</hi> as a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">laceuth/rion</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 106 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dolatus: <entryFree id="n14648" type="hapax" key="do^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hewing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 836</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dolens: <entryFree id="n14649" type="main" key="do^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from doleo.</entryFree>
dolenter: <entryFree id="n14650" type="main" key="do^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>doleo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
dolentia: <entryFree id="n14651" type="main" key="do^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>doleo</etym>, <sense id="n14651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolentulus: <entryFree id="n14652" type="main" key="do^lentu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlentŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n14652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dim. adj.</hi> [dolens]: maritus, Ren. Inscr. Afric. 3844.</sense></entryFree>
doleo: <entryFree id="n14653" type="main" key="do^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum</itype> (doliturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 732</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:257 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 257 al.</bibl>; cf. also under !*?), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n14653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [perh. root in Sansc. dar-, dal-, to tear apart; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">de/rw</foreign>, to flay; Ger. zehren, to consume; Eng. tear]. </sense><sense id="n14653.1" n="I" level="1"> Corporeally, <hi rend="ital">to feel pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ache</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo caput Tollere, ita dolui, itaque ego nunc doleo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">doleo ab animo, doleo ab oculis, doleo ab aegritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cor dolet, et si jecur, aut pulmones, aut praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:7" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pes, oculi, caput, latera, pulmones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput a sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 10, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirae omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes aegri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">misero nunc malae dolent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 252</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non metuo, ne quid mihi doleat, quod ferias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of the pangs of childbirth: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucina dolentibus Juno dicta puerperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of part affected (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">graviter oculos dolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Amic. 16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Amic. 16</bibl></cit>: doluisse te inguina cognosco, Marc. Aur. Ep. ad M. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 5, 19, 34</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: mihi dolet, quom <cb n="DOLI" /> ego vapulo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 44</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si stimulos pugnis caedis, manibus plus dolet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14653.2" n="II" level="1"> Mentally. </sense><sense id="n14653.3" n="A" level="2"> Of personal subjects, <hi rend="ital">to grieve for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deplore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sorry for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be afflicted at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi> any thing (so most freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14653.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum casum luctumque doluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 69, 145</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 13, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionis mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 29 al.</bibl>: injurias alicujus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 112</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n14653.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiores non dolere (debent), se a suis superari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 64, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:900" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 900</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 434</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 352</bibl> et saep. —With simple <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 62</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14653.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetari bonis rebus et dolere contrariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua (epistola) lecta de Atticae febricula valde dolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicto (opp. gaudere correctione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laude aliena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clade accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriis civitatis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeso Metello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus negatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercule deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:257" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapto Ganymede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14653.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Hortensio te certo scio dolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 831</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:84 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 84 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo gravius homines ex commutatione rerum doleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ex me doluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">EX QVO (sc. filio) NIHIL VNQVAM DOLVIT NISE CVM IS NON FVIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4609</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doluisse se, quod populi Romani beneficium sibi extorqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 5</bibl>: doleo, quia doles et angere, Luccei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">doliturus, si placeant spe deterius nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah! nescis quam doleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et desperant et dolent et novissime oderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:23" default="NO">9, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:26" default="NO">9, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 733</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 12</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars dolere pro gloria imperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 1</bibl></cit> Kritz.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 17</bibl>.—So, dolentes, <hi rend="ital">the mourners</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14653.8" n="B" level="2"> Of subjects not personal, <hi rend="ital">to pain</hi> one (rare and mostly ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n14653.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus mihi dolet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">Phr.</hi> Caput mihi condoluit. <hi rend="ital">Str.</hi> Quid mihi futurum'st, quoi duae ancillae dolent, i. e. <hi rend="ital">are a painful subject</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolet illud huic quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it pains me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am grieved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I grieve.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14653.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: CONDISCES (i. e. condiscens = condiscipulus) CVI DOLET PRO AFRICANO, Corp. Inscr. L. 1, 2258 <hi rend="ital">a</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi dolebit, non tibi, si quid ego stulte fecero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 10</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 37</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prov.: cui dolet meminit, Anglice,</quote> <trans><tr>the burnt child dreads the fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 20, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14653.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. personae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida Eoo me dolet aura gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14653.12" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolet (sc. mihi) dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dolent prava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 2</bibl></cit>.—!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">deponent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">DE QVA NIHIL ALIVD DOLITVS EST (vir) NISI MORTEM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 793, 4</bibl></cit>, and 794, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">DOLEATVR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 676, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">causing pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">painful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil dolentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 246</bibl></cit>.—More freq., <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">painfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with sorrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolenter hoc dicam potius quam contumeliose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 24, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 4 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 6, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
doliaris: <entryFree id="n14654" type="main" key="do_li^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōlĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dolium</etym>, <sense id="n14654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a cask</hi>: vinum, <hi rend="ital">in cask</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">new</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not yet drawn off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:1:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 6, 1, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <trans><tr>like a barrel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
doliarius: <entryFree id="n14655" type="main" key="do_li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a cask</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casks.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14655.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">DOLEARIA OFFICINA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4888</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14655.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dōlĭārĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the place where wine-casks are kept;</hi> corresp. to our <hi rend="ital">wine-cellar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:35:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 35, § 7</bibl>. <pb n="607" /> <cb n="DOLO" /></sense></entryFree>
dolicha: <entryFree id="n14656" type="main" key="Do^li^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlĭcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-e</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Thessalia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolichenus: <entryFree id="n14657" type="gloss" key="Do^li^che_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlĭchēnus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlŏcēnus</orth>, <sense id="n14657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>, v. Marini Att. de' Frat. Arv. p. 538 sq.</sense></entryFree>
dolichodromos: <entryFree id="n14658" type="main" key="do^li^cho_^dro^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlĭchō^drŏmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dolixodro/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n14658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the long course</hi> in racing, of twenty stadia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolichos: <entryFree id="n14659" type="main" key="Do^li^chos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlĭchos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The name of a gladiator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14660" type="main" key="do^li^chos2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlĭchos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">do/lixos</foreign>, <sense id="n14660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perhaps <hi rend="ital">the kidney-bean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 92, § 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolidus: <entryFree id="n14661" type="main" key="do^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dolor</etym>, <sense id="n14661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painful</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dolio: <entryFree id="n14662" type="main" key="do^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. 1. dolo <sense id="n14662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
doliolum: <entryFree id="n14663" type="main" key="do_li^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōlĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dolium</etym>, <sense id="n14663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cask.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14663.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14663.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Nom. propr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōliŏla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place in Rome</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=157" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 157</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=69:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 69, 8</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n14663.3" n="II" level="1"> Doliola florum, <hi rend="ital">the calyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 13, 13, § 32</bibl>; cf. Schneid. on <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. p. 579" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. p. 579</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolito: <entryFree id="n14664" type="hapax" key="do^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [doleo], <hi rend="ital">to pain greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ache</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:7" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolium: <entryFree id="n14665" type="main" key="do_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, (<number>plur.</number> written DOLEA, Calend. ap. Orell. Inscr. II. p. 381), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dai/dalos, daida/leos</foreign>, skilfully wrought; Lat. dolo</etym>, <sense id="n14665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very large jar of globular form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a wide mouth</hi> (cf.: vas, arpa, seria, cadus, lagena, culeus, amphora, urna, congius, cyathus, urceus, testa, etc.): dolium aut seria, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:69:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 69, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:308" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 308</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:70" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 47</bibl> et saep.: de dolio haurire, <hi rend="ital">wine from the jar</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">new</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not yet drawn off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:288" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 288</bibl>.—Prov.: in pertusum ingerimus dicta dolium, for <hi rend="ital">to talk in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 135</bibl>; cf. cribrum.—</sense><sense id="n14665.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A meteor having the form of a</hi> dolium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 847</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolo: <entryFree id="n14666" type="main" key="do^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (access. form of the part. pass. dolītus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 99, 17</bibl>, and 436, 15), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. dar-, dal-, to tear apart; whence doleo; Lat. dolium</etym>, <sense id="n14666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chip with an axe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hew.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14666.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:31" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>: scyphum caelo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 99, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perticas in quadrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes falce dolatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 59: <cit><quote lang="la">dolato confisus ligno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non est e robore dolatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lapidibus dolatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14666.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuste,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cudgel soundly</tr>, <tr>belabor</tr>, <tr>drub</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: uxorem, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 1</bibl>. Cf. dedolo.—</sense><sense id="n14666.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(historiam) sicut potuit, dolavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 54</bibl></cit>.—And in an alliteration: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie hunc dolum dolamus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to fashion</tr>, <tr>contrive</tr>, <tr>devise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14666.4" n="2" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">do/lwn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a staff with a short sharp iron point; a pike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sword-stick</hi> (cf.: lancea, spiculum, gaesum, hastile, sarissa, sparus): ingens contus cum ferro brevissimo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 664</bibl>. So Verg. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:250" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 250</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14666.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A small sword-cane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hidden dagger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 52</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 9, 4</bibl>; Serv. Verg. l. l.— </sense><sense id="n14666.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">a fly's sting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14666.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The fore-topsail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes">45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14667" type="main" key="Do^lo2" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n14667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*do/lwn</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n14667.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spy of the Trojans in the Trojan war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 98</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 347</bibl> Serv, Macr S. 5, 16 al.—</sense><sense id="n14667.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Priam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab 90" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolopes: <entryFree id="n14668" type="main" key="Do^lo^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlŏpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (<sense id="n14668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sing. acc.</hi> Dolopem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 58</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*do/lopes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Dolopes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Dolopians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned in fable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl> (who reckons them among the Aetolians); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 364</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14668.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n14668.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlŏpēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Dolopes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Dolopian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">busta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14668.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlŏpēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Dolopian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ctimene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14668.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏlŏpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the part of Thessaly formerly inhabited by the Dolopes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dolor: <entryFree id="n14669" type="main" key="do^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>doleo</etym>, <sense id="n14669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ache</hi> (freq. and class.; for syn. cf.: aegrimonia, <cb n="DOLO" /> maeror, maestitia, luctus, plangor, tristitia, angor, anxietas, cura, sollicitudo). </sense><sense id="n14669.1" n="I" level="1"> Corporeal: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor est motus asper in corpore, alienus a sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: dolores atque carnificinas facere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1075" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1075</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium, oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of the pangs of childbirth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utero exorti dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48</bibl>; 3, 1, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 33</bibl> (with labor); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 33</bibl> (with laborare); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 2 al.</bibl>—Comic., of the <hi rend="ital">gripings</hi> in the stomach of a hungry person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14669.2" n="II" level="1"> Mental, as a general designation of every painful, oppressive feeling, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affliction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chagrin</hi>, etc. (syn. luctus): <cit><quote lang="la">dolor (est) aegritudo crucians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cadit in sapientem animi dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta est cura in animo, quantum corde capio dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in labore atque in dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem laetitiam ex desiderio bonorum percepimus, quam ex laetitia improborum dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. laetatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te dolorem, quem acceperis cum summi viri tum amicissimi morte, ferre moderate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">magno esse Germanis dolori Ariovisti mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 38, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum et acerbum dolorem commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore angi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 18</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14669.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">indignation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animosity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resentment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ego in hac sententia dicenda non parebo dolori meo, non iracundiae serviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et rei publicae injuriam et suum dolorem condonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui accipit injuriam, et meminit et prae se fert dolorem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno dolore affici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 33, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: in eas (naves) indiligentiae suae ac doloris iracundia erupit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis indomitas tantus dolor excitat iras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 594</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 15, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amator agit ubi secum, Accedam? an potius mediter finire dolores,</quote> <trans><tr>the torments of love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 263</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 519</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:27" default="NO">3, 20, 27</bibl> (4, 20, 17 M.) et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonem veteres inimicitiae Caesaris incitant et dolor repulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">repulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugis amissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 688</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">justus mihi dolor etiam adversus deos esset, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 71</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem longa consumit dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor decrescit, ubi quo crescat non habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:129" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 129</bibl></cit> (Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n14669.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Terror</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14669.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14669.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A grief</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an object</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause of grief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (potest) etiam duris mentibus esse dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14669.7" n="2" level="3"> In rhet. lang. for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pa/qos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">passionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warm expression; pathos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 37, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolorosus: <entryFree id="n14670" type="main" key="do^lo_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlōrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dolor</etym>, <sense id="n14670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of sorrow</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dolose: <entryFree id="n14671" type="main" key="do^lo_se"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlōse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. dolosus <sense id="n14671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dolositas: <entryFree id="n14672" type="main" key="do^lo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dolosus</etym>, <sense id="n14672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 37, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dolosus: <entryFree id="n14673" type="main" key="do^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dolus</etym>, <sense id="n14673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crafty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi> (rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; for syn. cf.: subdolus, fraudulentus, fallax; <cit><quote lang="la">callidus, astutus, vafer, veterator, etc.): conservus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidicina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epid. 3, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 13, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: consilia, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 473</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Ev. Joan. Tract. 116, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statera,</quote> <trans><tr>false</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 20, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pondera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,038:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mich. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici, Ferre jugum pariter dolosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 28</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jupiter</tr>, <tr>changed into a bull</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedis per ignes Suppositos cineri doloso,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deceitful</tr>, <tr>treacherous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nummus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pers. prol. 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">craftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitfully</hi> (class.), Plaut. <cb n="DOME" /> Ps. 4, 2, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:5:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 5, 10 al.</bibl>—No <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dolus: <entryFree id="n14674" type="greek" key="do^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. dal-bhas, deceit; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">do/los</foreign>, cunning, <foreign lang="greek">de/lear</foreign>, bait</etym>. Orig., <sense id="n14674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a device</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">evil intent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongdoing with a view to the consequences</hi> (opp. culpa, <hi rend="ital">negligence;</hi> cf. also: fallacia, fraus, astutia, calliditas).—In the older, and esp. the jurid. lang.: dolus malus, a standing expression for <hi rend="ital">guile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>: doli vocabulum nunc tantum in malis utimur, apud antiquos etiam in bonis rebus utebatur. Unde adhuc dicimus <hi rend="ital">Sine dolo malo</hi>, nimirum quia solebat dici et bonus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=69:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 69, 10</bibl> Müll.: in quibus ipsis (formulis) cum ex eo (sc. Aquillio) quaereretur, quid esset <hi rend="ital">dolus malus?</hi> respondebat; <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset aliud simulatum, aliud actum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30</bibl>: Labeo sic definit: <hi rend="ital">Dolum malum</hi> esse omnem calliditatem, fallaciam, machinationem ad circumveniendum, fallendum, decipiendum alterum adhibitam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>; so, dolus malus, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 30, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolo malo instipulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; in a pub. law formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; and 38, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 9</bibl> Don.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3</bibl> tit.: de dolo malo, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 4</bibl> tit.: de doli mali et metus exceptione, et saep.; opp. culpa, Cod. 5, 40, 9.—Far more freq. and class. (but rarely in Cic.), </sense><sense id="n14674.1" n="II" level="1"> Without malus, <hi rend="ital">guile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dicam dolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dolo dicam tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; ita omnes meos dolos, fallacias, Praestigias praestrinxit commoditas patris, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic quia bonae artes desunt, dolis atque fallaciis contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ductare dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 28 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam doli non doli sunt, nisi astu colas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with astu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 704</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with astutia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per sycophantiam atque per doctos dolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dolum atque insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with this last cf.: magis virtute quam dolo contendere, aut insidiis niti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolo pugnandum est, dum quis par non est armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus atque occasionem fraudis ac doli quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with fraus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio etiam additus dolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dolum ac proditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolis instructus et arte Pelasgā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 152</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">subterranei = cuniculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 742</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 858</bibl> and 863; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 26, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14674.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the means</hi> or <hi rend="ital">instrument of deceit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolos saltu deludit, i. e. the nets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterraneis dolis peractum urbis excidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—Dolus, as a deity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:205" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 205</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superavit dolum Trojanum,</quote> <trans><tr>Dolon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14674.3" n="B" level="2"> = culpa: <cit><quote lang="la">dolo factum suo,</quote> <trans><tr>by his own fault</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
doma: <entryFree id="n14675" type="greek" key="do_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dw=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n14675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 106</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 63, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 5, 8</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
domabilis: <entryFree id="n14676" type="main" key="do^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>domo</etym>, <sense id="n14676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be tamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamable</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word): <cit><quote lang="la">Cantaber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 253</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domator: <entryFree id="n14677" type="main" key="do^ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. domitor <sense id="n14677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
domefactus: <entryFree id="n14678" type="hapax" key="do^me^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>domo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n14678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdued.</hi>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus aratro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 99, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
domesticatim: <entryFree id="n14679" type="hapax" key="do^mesti^ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmestĭcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>domesticus</etym>, <sense id="n14679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at home</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparare aliquid (opp. oblocare macellariis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
domesticatus: <entryFree id="n14680" type="main" key="do^mesti^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmestĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office and dignity of the</hi> princeps domesticorum (also called primiceriatus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 11</bibl> and 12.</sense></entryFree>
domestice: <entryFree id="n14681" type="main" key="do^mesti^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmestĭce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14681.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
domesticus: <entryFree id="n14682" type="main" key="do^mesti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmestĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>domus</etym>, <sense id="n14682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the house.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14682.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dico intra domesticos parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>a garment to wear in the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticus otior,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 128</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n14682.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to one's family; domestic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">familiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">household.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14682.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n14682.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: in luctu domestico. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 578</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl></cit>: domesticis praeceptis ernditus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: usus et consuetudo cum ali <pb n="608" /> <cb n="DOMI" /> quo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc.
