Am. 6</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit> prooem. § 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo prope domesticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praedones (with hospites and amici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">clades (with avunculus absumptus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesia,</quote> <trans><tr>the church in the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 16, 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14682.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmestĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the members of a family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inmates of a household</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 16, 2</bibl> al.—Also, <hi rend="ital">family domestics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">household slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>; and for the <hi rend="ital">escort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue</hi> of a person, Cod. Th. 1, 12, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 7</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>body-guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Numer. 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14682.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14682.7" n="1" level="3"> Opp. to what is foreign or public, <hi rend="ital">domestic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native; private</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae rei frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si superavissent vel domesticis opibus vel externis auxiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">externa lubentius in tali re quam domestica recordor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse transmarinis nec importatis artibus eruditus, sed genuinis domesticisque virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mos (opp. adventicia doctrina),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">insolens domesticarum rerum fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienigenas domesticis anteferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>intestine</tr>, <tr>civil war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiae (with intestinum scelus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et intestinum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac vernaculum crimen (opp. Romam de provincia apportatum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta celebrare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of their own country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 287</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">res domesticas ac familiares (opp. rem publicam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domestica et publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vestitum, sic sententiam habeas aliam domesticam, aliam forensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris claros domestica destruebat infamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:83:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 83, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus privatis ac domesticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14682.8" n="2" level="3"> (Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)kei=os</foreign>) = proprius, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">personal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one's own</hi> (opp. alienus): <cit><quote lang="la">si ex ipsorum domestico incommodo nullus dolor insideret, etc., ex domestico judicio atque animi conscientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 38, 132</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Furiae, i. e. in his own heart,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmestĭce</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">et secrete,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confectus libellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:36" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
domicenium: <entryFree id="n14683" type="main" key="do^mi^ce_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭcēnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>domus-cena</etym>, <sense id="n14683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meal at home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">household fare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trinoctiale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:77:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 77, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
domicilium: <entryFree id="n14684" type="main" key="do^mi^ci^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭcĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>domus and cel-, root of celare, to conceal; cf.: cella, occulere</etym>, <sense id="n14684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a habitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domicile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abode</hi> (freq. and class.; for syn. cf.: aedes, domus, tectum, casa, tugurium, habitatio, mansio, sedes, etc.). </sense><sense id="n14684.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:86:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 86, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 5, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14684.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (esp. freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla alia in civitate, nisi in qua populi potestas summa est, ullum domicilium libertas habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capuae, in Domicilio superbiae collocati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestissimum senectutis (Lacedaemo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 18, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii et gloriae (Roma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbissimorum sermonum in auribus alicujus collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui verbo (sc. fideliter) domicilium est proprium in officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
domicoenium: <entryFree id="n14685" type="main" key="do^mi^coeni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭcoenĭum</orth>, v. domicenium.</entryFree>
domicurius: <entryFree id="n14686" type="main" key="do^mi^cu_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭcūrius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>domus-cura</etym>, <sense id="n14686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steward</hi>, Ren. Insc. Afr. 260.</sense></entryFree>
domiducus: <entryFree id="n14687" type="main" key="Do^mi^du_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏmĭdūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏmĭdūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>domus-duco</etym>, <sense id="n14687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god that conducts home</hi>, epithet of Jupiter and Juno, as deities of marriage, who bring the bride to her husband's home, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 6:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:7:3" default="NO">7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domina: <entryFree id="n14688" type="main" key="do^mi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>dat.</case> and <sense id="n14688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> only dominis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1629</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dominus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n14688.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she who rules</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commands</hi>, esp. in a household, = hera, materfamilias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:34 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 34 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:376" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 376</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:377 al" default="NO">377 al.</bibl> <cb n="DOMI" /> —</sense><sense id="n14688.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">de/spoina</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lady</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit sane Fors domina campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec una virtus omnium est domina et regina virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates blandissimae dominae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas honoris, imperii, provinciarum quam dura est domina!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncti currum dominae subiere leones, i. e. of Cybele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">438</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3, 31</bibl> (4, 2, 31 M.); <cit><quote lang="la">of Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Isis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 82, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1884</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:16:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 16, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14688.3" n="b" level="4"> As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">domina Urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>the queen city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:21:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 21, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14688.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14688.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The appellation of a lady belonging to the imperial family</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14688.6" n="2" level="3"> A term of endearment, </sense><sense id="n14688.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 397</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2663</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14688.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sweetheart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:74" default="NO">3, 4, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
dominans: <entryFree id="n14689" type="main" key="do^mi^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. <itype>dominor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
dominanter: <entryFree id="n14690" type="main" key="do^mi^nanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>dominor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
dominatio: <entryFree id="n14691" type="main" key="do^mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dominor</etym>, <sense id="n14691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14691.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., among the republican Romans, mostly with an odious secondary meaning, <hi rend="ital">unrestricted power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absolute dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lordship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyranny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despotism</hi> (good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">for syn. cf.: regnum, dicio, imperium, potestas, magistratus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl></cit> (opp. libertas, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl>; Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 42 al.</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl> et saep.—In the <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Mos.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 1:9, p. 214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 1, 9, p. 214</bibl> ed. Gerl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:144:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 144, 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14691.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = dominantes, <hi rend="ital">rulers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lords</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despots.—Sing. collect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam eam dominationem in carcerem detraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:24:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14691.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnumque judiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regia in judiciis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firma et moderata rationis in libididem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14691.4" n="2" level="3"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">angels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiritual powers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Colos. 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dominator: <entryFree id="n14692" type="main" key="do^mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lord</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum Deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:34:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 34, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dominatrix: <entryFree id="n14693" type="main" key="do^mi^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dominator</etym>, <sense id="n14693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi> (very rare): caeca ac temeraria dominatrix animi cupiditas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">freti (Creta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 85" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jerem. 13, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dominatus: <entryFree id="n14694" type="main" key="do^mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<case>dat.</case> dominatu, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16, 8</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dominor</etym>, <sense id="n14694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">absolute rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereignty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mastery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyranny</hi> (good prose; most frequent in Cicero; for syn. v. dominatio). </sense><sense id="n14694.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 27</bibl> (opp. libertas; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl></cit>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 517</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14694.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:3:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum (with principatus and potestas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis terrenorum commodorum est in homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dominicus: <entryFree id="n14695" type="main" key="do^mi^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnĭcus</orth> (contr. DOMNICUS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3201</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dominus</etym>, <sense id="n14695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a lord</hi> or <hi rend="ital">master</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n14695.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: gannire ad aurem numquam didici dominicam, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Differ. 86</bibl> (v. 282 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">rationes pecuariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">1: palatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">GENIUS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">APOTHECA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2591 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14695.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14695.3" n="A" level="2"> Since the formation of the empire, <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">OPERA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1243 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏmĭnĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a collection of poems by the Emperor Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14695.4" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., </sense><sense id="n14695.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Dominica dies, <hi rend="ital">the Lord's Day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sunday</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Coron. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jejun. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14695.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Dominica cena, <hi rend="ital">the Lord's Supper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 11, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dominium: <entryFree id="n14696" type="main" key="do^mi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n14696.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to dominus, II. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">A feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banquet</hi> (very rare): dominia convivia, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 281, 25</bibl> (with sodalitia); * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14696.1" n="II" level="1"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right of ownership</hi> (absolute <cb n="DOMI" /> ownership, opp. possessio, cf. Sandars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. Introd. p. 47" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. Introd. p. 47</bibl>); esp. <hi rend="ital">paramount ownership</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent domain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo solo dominium Populi Romani est vel Caesaris: nos autem possessionem tantum habere videmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominium et jus eorum qui dederint esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 13, 15</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jus et imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 1</bibl></cit>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:54" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:2:40" default="NO">2, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; cf. Rein's Privatr. p. 129 sq.—</sense><sense id="n14696.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lordship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tobiae, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl> Mac. 11, 8.—</sense><sense id="n14696.3" n="C" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">lord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertissima dominia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dominor: <entryFree id="n14697" type="main" key="do^mi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (ante-class. <sense id="n14697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf</hi> domina rier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 70</bibl>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [dominus], <hi rend="ital">to be lord and master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear rule domineer</hi> (freq. and class.; for syn. cf.: regno, impero, jubeo, praesum). </sense><sense id="n14697.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperare quam plurimis, pollere, regnare, dominari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <trans><tr>absol</tr>.,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 363</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in capite fortunisque hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:315 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 315 al.</bibl>— With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: inter aliquos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominari in cetera (animalia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adversarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā dominarier arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 70</bibl></cit>.—With the <case>abl.</case> only, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 766</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 285</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 97</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toti dominabere mundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 143</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 1 al.</bibl> in late Lat.—</sense><sense id="n14697.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, etc., of inanimate and abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">Cleanthes solem dominari putat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestis in magnae dominatur moenibus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nitentia culta Infelix lolium et steriles dominantur avenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 154</bibl></cit>: ubi libido dominatur, Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:65:219" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 65, 219</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas (sc. censura) longinquitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus dicendi in libera civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25, 71</bibl>: actio in dicendo, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">effectus maxime in ingressu ac fine (causae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">7 et saep.: senectus si usque ad ultimum spiritum dominatur in suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9, 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ruling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing sway.</hi>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a gentibus dominantibus premi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 15, 5</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus dominantior ad vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 397</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 238</bibl>: dominantia nomina = vulgaria, communia, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ku/ria</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without metaphor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 234</bibl>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an absolute ruler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dominante sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 74</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:50:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 50, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 19, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnante</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of a ruler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Hexaem. 1, 331</bibl>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be ruled</hi>: o domus antiqua, heu, quam dispari Dominare domino! Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl>; Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 16, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dominulus: <entryFree id="n14698" type="hapax" key="do^mi^nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little lord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lordling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:41:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 41, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dominus: <entryFree id="n14699" type="main" key="do^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭnus</orth> (in inscrr. sometimes written by syncop. DOMNVS), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. damanas, he who subdues, root dam-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dama/w, da/mnhmi</foreign>, v. domo</etym> Prop., one who has subdued or conquered; hence, <sense id="n14699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proprietor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">owner</hi> (cf. herus). </sense><sense id="n14699.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: quam dispari Dominare domino! Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec domo dominus, sed domino domus honestanda est, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 39, 139</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vilicus) consideret, quae dominus imperaverit, fiant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:5:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 5, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 355, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 11</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. ancilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 276</bibl></cit>; and (with herus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:90 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 90 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63</bibl> et saep.—Also of the master's son, <hi rend="ital">the young master</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siet in iis agris, qui non saepe dominos mutant ... de domino bono colono melius emetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 174</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rerum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: auctionum, id. <pb n="609" /> <cb n="DOMI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 61</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14699.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proprietor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">owner</hi> (in republican Rome of public men, usually with the accessory notion, unlawful, despotic): <cit><quote lang="la">hujus principis populi et omnium gentium domini atque victoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe qui (sc. populi) domini sint legum, judiciorum, belli, pacis, foederum, capitis, uniuscujusque, pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di domini omnium rerum ac moderatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videsne, ut de rege (sc. Tarquinio) dominus exstiterit? hic est enim dominus populi, quem Graeci tyrannum vocant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 214</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberatos se per eum dicunt gravissimis dominis, terrore sempiterno ac nocturno metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the judge: qui rei dominus futurus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>; poët. of <hi rend="ital">the possessor of an art</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 524</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 138</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14699.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, sometimes as an <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominae manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:578" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere caput domina venale sub hasta,</quote> <trans><tr>the auction spear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14699.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14699.5" n="1" level="3"> With or without convivii or epuli, <hi rend="ital">the master of a feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the entertainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">host</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 13</bibl>; Lucil., Varr., and Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 281, 21 sq.</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14699.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The master of a play</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of public games; the employer</hi> of players or gladiators: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi atque vobis res vortat bene Gregique huic et dominis atque conductoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14699.7" n="3" level="3"> In the period of the empire (Augustus and Tiberius declined it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 27</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a title of the emperors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:72" default="NO">10, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1146 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14699.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A term of endearment in addressing a lover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14699.9" n="5" level="3"> In respectful greeting, like our <hi rend="ital">Sir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:88" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14699.10" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A master</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assignee</hi> of a forfeited estate, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14699.11" n="7" level="3"> Of Christ, <hi rend="ital">the Lord</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Augusti Caesaris temporibus natus est Dominus Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 13, 13</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
domiporta: <entryFree id="n14700" type="hapax" key="do^mi^porta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭporta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>domus-porto</etym>, <sense id="n14700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that carries her house on her back</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the snail, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domiseda: <entryFree id="n14701" type="gloss" key="do^mi^se^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭsĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>domus-sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n14701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who stays at home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domestic</hi> (cf. sedentarius), an epithet of a woman, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4639</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domitianus: <entryFree id="n14702" type="main" key="Do^mi^ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏmĭtĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, T. Flavius, <sense id="n14702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Vespasian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Titus</hi>, who reigned 81-96 A.D., Suet. Dom. <hi rend="ital">passim;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 86</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏ-mĭtĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: via, <hi rend="ital">a road constructed by him</hi>, a branch of the Via Appia, running from Sinuessa to Puteoli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4 praef.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl>: mensis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">October</hi>, in which the Emperor Domitian was born, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domitius: <entryFree id="n14703" type="main" key="do^mi^ti^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>domus</etym>, <sense id="n14703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the house</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans><tr>who protects those married in the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14704" type="main" key="Do^mi^ti^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏmĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n14704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the appellation of a Roman</hi> gens. So Cn. Domitius Calvinus, <hi rend="ital">tribune</hi> A. U. C. 695; <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 701, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sest, 53, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 7, 16 al.</bibl>—Cn. Domitius, <hi rend="ital">censor</hi> 638 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">who conquered the Allobroges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">and after whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was named the Domitia Via</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:ib. 4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl>.—Cn. Domitius Aënobarbus, <hi rend="ital">from whom is named the</hi> Lex Domitia de sacerdotiis, 649 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 35, 1</bibl>.—L. Domitius Aënobarbus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 699 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">and general of Pompey in the civil war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl> sq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏmĭtĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl> sq.—Cn. Domitius Calvinus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 700 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13</bibl> et saep.—Cn. Domitius Aënobarbus, <hi rend="ital">husband of Agrippina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl>.—Domitia, <hi rend="ital">sister of the last-named</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Crispus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:24" default="NO">10, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 19</bibl>.—Domitia Lepida, <hi rend="ital">Messalina's mother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 37 sq.</bibl>—But Cn. Domitius Corbulo, <hi rend="ital">brother of Caesonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Caligula's wife</hi>, famous for his <cb n="DOMU" /> size and strength, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:251" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 8</bibl>, was not of this gens.</sense></entryFree>
domito: <entryFree id="n14705" type="main" key="do^mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>domo</etym>, <sense id="n14705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break in</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. first used by Verg.): boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedum omne genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: currus (i. e. <hi rend="ital">a team</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domitor: <entryFree id="n14706" type="main" key="do^mi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭtor</orth> (also post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmātor</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 5</bibl>; but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:116" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 116</bibl>, the true reading is domante), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tamer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaker</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n14706.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 189</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">651 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4179</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14706.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a subduer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conqueror</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexator furoris, domitor armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">belli externi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persarum (with victor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispaniae Galliaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris (Neptunus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 799</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">freti Tiphys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domitor ac frenator infinitae potestatis (animus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:9" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curarum (somnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 75" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
domitrix: <entryFree id="n14707" type="main" key="do^mi^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>domitor</etym>, <sense id="n14707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who tames</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subdues</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n14707.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum Epidaurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">FERARVM DOMITRICEM DIANAM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1447</bibl></cit>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum clava (Herculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14707.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium (ferrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
domitura: <entryFree id="n14708" type="main" key="do^mi^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>domo</etym>, <sense id="n14708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaking</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domitus: <entryFree id="n14709" type="main" key="do^mi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from domo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14710" type="hapax" key="do^mi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>domo</etym>, <sense id="n14710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
domnaedius: <entryFree id="n14711" type="gloss" key="domnaedi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">domnaedĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dominus-aedes</etym>, <sense id="n14711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a landlord</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4787</bibl>; cf.: Marini Atti, 2, p. 644.</sense></entryFree>
domnicus: <entryFree id="n14712" type="gloss" key="domni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">domnĭcus</orth>, v. dominicus.</entryFree>
domnifunda: <entryFree id="n14713" type="gloss" key="domni^funda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">domnĭfunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>domina-fundus</etym>, <sense id="n14713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a landlady</hi>, Inscr, Orell. 4584.</sense></entryFree>
domnipraedia: <entryFree id="n14714" type="gloss" key="domnipraedi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">domnipraedĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>domina-praedium</etym>, <sense id="n14714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a landlady</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domnus: <entryFree id="n14715" type="gloss" key="domnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">domnus</orth>, v. dominus <sense id="n14715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
domo: <entryFree id="n14716" type="main" key="do^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmo</orth>, <itype>ui, ĭtum</itype> (also dŏmāvi, Poëta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 252</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 6</bibl>: <sense id="n14716.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">domata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 14</bibl></cit>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root dam-, dām - yāmi, to be tame; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">damnhi, da/mar, dama/lhs, dmw/s</foreign>; Germ. zähmen; Eng. tame</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> (class.; for syn. cf.: vinco, supero, devinco, fundo, fugo, profligo, subigo, subicio). </sense><sense id="n14716.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: vim taurorum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 252</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 315 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">et condocefacere feras beluas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 25</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">asinum ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">boves aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:22:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">trop., linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14716.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas nationes nemo umquam fuit, quin frangi domarique cuperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 6</bibl> ct saep.; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: hostis vino domiti somnoque sepulti, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. 291 ed. Vahl.): quae te cumque domat Venus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrior illum Cura domat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos longa domant inopi jejunia victu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram rastris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 68, § 200</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima sulphure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus fluminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: uvam prelo, 1. e. <hi rend="ital">to press</hi>, Hor C. 1, 20, 9 partem tergoris ferventibus undis, i e. <hi rend="ital">to boil soft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 651</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impexos crines certo ordine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domitos habere oculos et manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domitas habere libidines, coercere omnes cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus omnia domuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidum spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 144</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
domucula: <entryFree id="n14717" type="main" key="do^mu^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>domus</etym>, <sense id="n14717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a porch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domuitio: <entryFree id="n14718" type="main" key="do^mu^i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmŭĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for domum itio; cf.: reditum ac domum itionem dari, Civ. Div. 1, 32, 68</etym>, <sense id="n14718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a returning home</hi> (ante- and postclass.), Pac. and Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 357:9" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 357, 9</bibl>; Poëta (Enn.) ap. Auct. Her. <cb n="DOMU" /> 3, 21, 34 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 270" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 270</bibl> ed. Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
domuncula: <entryFree id="n14719" type="main" key="do^muncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>domus</etym>, <sense id="n14719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small house</hi> (not ante- Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:12:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 12, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (perh. also <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154</bibl>, inst. of domuscula).</sense></entryFree>
domus: <entryFree id="n14720" type="main" key="do^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmus</orth>, <itype>ūs and i</itype>, 2d and 4th decl., <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. damas, house; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">de/m-w</foreign>, to build, whence <foreign lang="greek">do/mos, des-po/ths</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">demspo/ths</foreign>; cf. Germ. Zimmer; Eng. timber, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n14720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">home</hi> (for syn. cf. aedes, casa, domicilium, habitatio; mansio, sedes, tectum, tugurium; aedificium, moles). —Forms of the cases. </sense><sense id="n14720.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14720.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 6 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 8 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14720.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>, in the comic poets only the ante-class. form domi: <cit><quote lang="la">haud quod tui me neque domi distaedeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeminit domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domi focique fac vicissim ut memineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi cupio (i.q. cupidus sum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; acc. to Don. Ter. l. l.: decora domi, Caecil. ap. Don. l. l.: conviva domi, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 337, 23</bibl>. But since Varro (except as infra, 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">domūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=162" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 162</bibl></cit> Müll. (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 356</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 318</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">645</bibl>; 6, 27; 53; 81; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl> et saep. C. 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—When more persons than one are spoken of, the <number>plur.</number> is freq. used: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:1 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 8, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos nostras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 3</bibl></cit>; and: suas domos, Liv 2, 7; but the <number>sing.</number> also: <cit><quote lang="la">Suebi domum reverti coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 54</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes also with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex in domum se recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domos atque in tecta refugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non introeo in nostram domum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 253</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venisse in M. Laecae domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
