C. 2, 18, 2</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14720.14" n="c" level="4"> Domo. </sense><sense id="n14720.15" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">From home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of the house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 7</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 89</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14720.16" n="(b)" level="5"> For domi, <hi rend="ital">at home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the house</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">domo sibi quaerere remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ubi domo nascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo se tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo abditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit> tabulae domo asservantur, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Apol. p. 541</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domo furtum factum ab eo, qui domi fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem quam e villa mea surripuit, in domo mea ponat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domo sua facere mysteria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illuc clamoris obsecro in nostra domo est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">educatus in domo Pericli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in domo ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lys. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14720.17" n="3" level="3"> In colloq. lang.: domi habere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to have a thing at home</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have it about one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have in abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be provided with it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">know it one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi habet animum falsiloquum ... Domi dolos, domi delenifica facta, domi fallacias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:36 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 36 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi habuit unde disceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 59</bibl></cit> Ruhnk. In a like sense: <cit><quote lang="la">id quidem domi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 4</bibl>: sed quid ego nunc haec ad te, cujus domi nascuntur? <foreign lang="greek">glau=k) ei)s *)aqh/nas</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14720.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">any sort of building</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abode.</hi> So of the labyrinth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a sacred grotto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 81</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the abode of the gods,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1</bibl></cit>; 101; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 736</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 269 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the winds,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 371</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 279</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of animals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 209</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:367" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 367</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of birds,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 235</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Danaë's prison,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 13, 12 M.); <cit><quote lang="la">of the tomb: marmorea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same, DOMVS AETERNA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1174</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4525</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">AETERNALIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4518</bibl></cit> (cf. in Heb. <foreign /> for the grave, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eccl.</author> 12, 5</bibl>); and: <cit><quote lang="la">CERTA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4850</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the body, as the dwelling of the soul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">458</bibl> et saep.</sense><sense id="n14720.19" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14720.20" n="A" level="2"> In a wider sense, <hi rend="ital">one's native place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">home. M. Su.</hi> Siculus sum Syracusanus. <hi rend="ital">M. So.</hi> Ea domus et patria est mihi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (with patria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 122</bibl>; also with patria as an <hi rend="ital">adjective</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 269</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:227 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 227 al.</bibl>: domi aetatem agere, opp. patriă procul, <cb n="DONE" /> Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 8, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones reveniunt domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 34, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 20 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Galli) domo emigrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui genus? unde domo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 183</bibl>.—Hence, the phrases belli domique, and domi militiaeque, <hi rend="ital">in war and peace</hi>, v. bellum and militia; <cit><quote lang="la">and cf.: noster populus in pace et domi imperat ... in bello sic paret, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14720.21" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A household</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=kos</foreign>, and the Heb. <foreign />, v. Gesen. Lex. s. h. v. 7): <cit><quote lang="la">domus te nostra tota salutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 53</bibl> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 284</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota domus duo sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 636</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:544" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 544</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 10, 6</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n14720.22" n="b" level="4"> In philos lang., <hi rend="ital">a philosophical school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
domuscula: <entryFree id="n14721" type="main" key="do^muscu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏmuscŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. domuncula.</entryFree>
donabilis: <entryFree id="n14722" type="main" key="do_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dono</etym>. <sense id="n14722.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That deserves to be presented with.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, infortunio hominem praedicas donabilem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14722.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That deserves to be presented</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
donarium: <entryFree id="n14723" type="main" key="do_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>donum</etym>, <sense id="n14723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place in a temple where the votive offerings were kept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a temple treasure-chamber</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 516</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 221</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14723.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14723.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A temple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctuary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 533</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:335" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 335</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 13, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14723.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A votive offering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 35" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:36:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 36, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
donaticus: <entryFree id="n14724" type="hapax" key="do_na_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dono</etym>, <sense id="n14724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given as a present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presented</hi>: hastae, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. OPTIONATUS, p. 201, 28 Müll.: DONATICAE coronae dictae, quod his victores in ludis donabantur, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=69:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 69, 5 sq.</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
donatio: <entryFree id="n14725" type="main" key="do_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presenting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a donation;</hi> in abstr. and concr. (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">donum, largitio, munus, donativum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 7</bibl>, de donationibus; the same title appears in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5</bibl>, and 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:5:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 5, 17 al.</bibl>; cf. Rein's Privatr. p. 202 sq., and 340.</sense></entryFree>
donativum: <entryFree id="n14726" type="main" key="do_na_ti_vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnātīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a largess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">donative</hi> given by the emperor to each soldier of the army, at his accession or majority, or other extraordinary occasion (v. congiarium, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. congiarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7 al.</bibl>—<pos>Adj.</pos>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 421, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
donator: <entryFree id="n14727" type="main" key="do_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">donor</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">in the jurists very freq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 7, § 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 54, 1</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1217" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
donatrix: <entryFree id="n14728" type="main" key="do_na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>donator</etym>, <sense id="n14728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who gives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female donor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 54, 20</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 191.</sense></entryFree>
donatus: <entryFree id="n14729" type="main" key="Do_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōnātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n14729.0" n="I" level="1"> Aelius D., <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman grammarian of the fourth century of our era</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of Jerome</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">commentator on Terence;</hi> cf. Baehr's <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 533 sq., and 68.—</sense><sense id="n14729.1" n="II" level="1"> Tiberius Claudius D., <hi rend="ital">a commentator on Vergil</hi>, who lived about A.D. 400; cf. Baehr's <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 91; Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 423.</sense></entryFree>
donax: <entryFree id="n14730" type="greek" key="do^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏnax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">do/nac</foreign>. <sense id="n14730.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of reed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cyprus-reed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:86" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 50, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:141" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 52, § 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14730.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-fish</hi> = solen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14730.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The male scallop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pecten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 32, § 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14730.3" n="IV" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏnax</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 2</bibl>, and 4.</sense></entryFree>
donec: <entryFree id="n14731" type="main" key="do_ne^c"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnĕc</orth>, <sense id="n14731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [shortened from ante- and post-class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnĭcum</orth>, <itype>from old dative doni</itype> (dioni; for root, etc., v. dies) and conj. cum; prop. <hi rend="ital">at the time of day when;</hi> form donicum, Liv. And., Cato and Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 178</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 146, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">149, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">161, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1</bibl>. 2, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 18</bibl>; Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 692</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 1, 4</bibl>.—In the Inscr. of Orell. 4370 DONIQVIES is i. q. DONIQUE IS, and <cb n="DONO" /> donique = donicum; so, <cit><quote lang="la">donique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:708" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 708</bibl> Lachm.].—Donec denotes the relation of two actions in time, </sense><sense id="n14731.1" n="I" level="1"> As contemporaneous, <hi rend="ital">as long as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during the time in which;</hi> or, </sense><sense id="n14731.2" n="II" level="1"> As in immediate succession, <hi rend="ital">until</hi>, <hi rend="ital">up to the time at which</hi> (synonymous with dum, I. B. and II.—in the ante-class. and postAug. periods freq.; four times in Cic. only in signif. II. with indic.; not in Caes.). </sense><sense id="n14731.3" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">As long as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while</hi> (so perh. not till the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n14731.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque dulces amores Sperne, puer, Donec virenti canities abest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec gratus eram tibi, etc. ... Persarum vigui rege beatior ... Donec non alia magis Arsisti, etc. ... Romanà vigui clarior Iliā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>, and 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec eris felix, multos numerabis amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14731.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(elephanti) nihil sane trepidabant, donec continenti velut ponte agerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edixit ne quis militis, donec in castris esset, bona possideret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:60" default="NO" valid="yes">60</bibl>; 21, 10; 25, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 64 al.</bibl></sense><sense id="n14731.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Until</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till at length</hi> (so in all periods). </sense><sense id="n14731.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (cf. Zumpt, Gr. § <cit><quote lang="la">575): ne quoquam exurgatis, donec a me erit signum datum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch, 4, 4, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud desinam, donec perfecero hoc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen finis . . . fiebat, donec populus senatum coëgit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic regnabitur ... donec regina sacerdos geminam partu dabit Ilia prolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 273</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 413</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque credebam Donec Sosia fecit sibi uti crederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1130</bibl>; Liv. praef. 3, 48; 23, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 630</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 35</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">me attrectare nefas, donec me flumine vivo abluero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socii consurgere tonsis ... Donec rostra tenent siccum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 301</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 268</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:290" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 290</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14731.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Actia pugna refertur, donec alterutrum velox Victoria fronde coronet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 63</bibl></cit>.—So in the <hi rend="ital">praes.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20 al.</bibl>—In the <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 860</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidationis aliquantum edebant, donec quietem ipse timor fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—So with <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14731.9" n="(g)" level="5"> Ellipt. without a verb: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quisquam hominem conspicatu'st donec in navi super,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. in foll. b. </sense><sense id="n14731.10" n="(g)" level="5">.—</sense><sense id="n14731.11" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">usque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usque adeo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usque eo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eo usque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in tantum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14731.12" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo odorans usque donec persecutus volpem ero vestigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id. aliquoties in die facito usque adeo donec sal desiverit tabescere biduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:88:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 88, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque eo timui, ne, etc. ... donec ad reiciendos judices venimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo usque me vivere vultis, donec haud ambiguum regem mea morte faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(humum) in tantum deprimere, donec altitudinis mensuram datam ceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14731.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque Sessuri, donec cantor "Vos plaudite" dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni istunc invitassitis Usque adeo, donec, qua domum abeat nesciat, Peristis ambo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eo usque trahatur spiritus donec deficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14731.14" n="(g)" level="5"> Ellipt. without a verb usque illud visumst Pamphilo ne utiquam grave, Donec jam in ipsis nuptiis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 51</bibl>; cf. above, a. </sense><sense id="n14731.15" n="(g)" level="5">.—</sense><sense id="n14731.16" n="B" level="2"> With negatives, donec often limits the time within which something is done or to be done, without implying that it is done or to be done after the limit; Engl., <hi rend="ital">till</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi> a certain time: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri vetuisse puerum, donec experrectus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si respexis, donicum ego te jussero, te dedam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl>. Cf. Hand, Turs. II. 291-299.</sense></entryFree>
donicum: <entryFree id="n14732" type="main" key="do_ni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnĭcum</orth>, <sense id="n14732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>, v. dōncc <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
donifico: <entryFree id="n14733" type="hapax" key="do_ni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>donum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n14733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make presents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 112" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
donique: <entryFree id="n14734" type="gloss" key="do_nique"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnique</orth>, v. donec <sense id="n14734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dono: <entryFree id="n14735" type="main" key="do_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>donum</etym>. <sense id="n14735.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To give</hi> one something <hi rend="ital">as a present; to present</hi>,<pb n="611" /> <cb n="DORC" />  <hi rend="ital">bestow; to grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vouchsafe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confer</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14735.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n14735.2" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">donavi ei, quae voluit, quae postulavit: te quoque ei dono dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pauca suis adjutoribus large effuseque donabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera ista civibus tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenam ex voto Laribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 65</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui non unius diei gratulationem, sed aeternitatem immortalitatemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis temporum velut subseciva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cadus) Spes donare novas largus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem cum dote fidemque, etc., regina pecunia donat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aurae) Omnia (mandata) discerpunt et nubibus irrita donant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 313</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14735.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">huic loricam Donat habere viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 262</bibl></cit> (acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dw=ken i(/ppon a)/gein</foreign>, Hom. Il. 23, 612); so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 701</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frui paratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinare magnus mihi donat Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14735.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Calliope, nostro donate labori, nota parum ut facta tradantur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:390" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 390</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14735.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi> (cf. condono): <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">iram patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:603" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 603</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14735.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to remit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgive</hi> a debt, obligation, or penalty. </sense><sense id="n14735.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedes habitationum annuas conductoribus donavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: legem, i. e. actionem lege datam, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>, Petr. poët. 18, 6; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, negotium (with componere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14735.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> for the more usual condonare, <hi rend="ital">to forgive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pardon</hi> an offence or him that committed it, for another's sake (so perhaps not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">culpa gravis precibus donatur saepe suorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 2, 7, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae damnatus donatur populo Romano, donatur tribuniciae potestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 5</bibl> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum memoriae patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 10</bibl> Duker.</sense><sense id="n14735.9" n="II" level="1"> Aliquem (aliquā re), <hi rend="ital">to present</hi> one with any thing (class. and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">donis plurimis donatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 137</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem paterā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem anulo aureo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem laureā Apollinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">meritos in proeliis more militiae donat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: donatus atque laudatus magnifice pro contione, id. ib 8, 2 et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: gaudent, currunt, celebrant, donant, tenent, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 317, 15</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. p. 193, ed. Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n14735.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Ante-class.: aliquem aliquid; <cit><quote lang="la">egon te pro hoc nuntio quid donem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>. —(But in Enn. ap. Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6</bibl> the right reading seems to be: fata docet fari, not fari donavit, v. Vahl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 7</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
donum: <entryFree id="n14736" type="main" key="do_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>do</etym>, <sense id="n14736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14736.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 138 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 138 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 27 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 55</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dona mittunt et munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 121</bibl></cit>; so with munus (usu. dona muneraque, = <hi rend="ital">bribery</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 24, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 12, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:7 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14736.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14736.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A present brought to a deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a votive offering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:752" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 752</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 439</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">turea,</quote> <trans><tr>offerings of incense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 225</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14736.4" n="B" level="2"> Ultima or suprema dona, <hi rend="ital">the last honors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funeral rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obsequies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:471" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 471</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1273" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1273</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
donusa: <entryFree id="n14737" type="main" key="Do^nu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏnūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Aegean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east of Naxos</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Denusa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place of banishment under the emperors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dorcadion: <entryFree id="n14738" type="main" key="dorca^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dorcădĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n14738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 14</bibl> and 62.</sense></entryFree>
dorcas: <entryFree id="n14739" type="greek" key="dorcas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dorcas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dorx</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">do/rc</foreign>; <sense id="n14739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. pl.</hi> <itype>dorcas</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 200</bibl>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dorcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">do/rkos</foreign>, Edict. Diocl. 4, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 45), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dorka/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a gazelle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antelope</hi>: Antilope dorcas, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:65:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 65, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:98:1" default="NO">13, 98, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dorceus: <entryFree id="n14740" type="main" key="Dorceus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dorceus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dorkeu/s</foreign> (qs. gazellecatcher), <sense id="n14740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of one of Actaeon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>. <cb n="DORM" /></sense></entryFree>
dorcium: <entryFree id="n14741" type="main" key="Dorci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dorcĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*do/rkion</foreign>), <sense id="n14741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a female slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dores: <entryFree id="n14742" type="main" key="Do_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Gr. <sense id="n14742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. pl.</hi> Dorieon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl>), <foreign lang="greek">*dwriei=s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Dorians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 27, 64</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">their progenitor</hi>, <itype>Dōrus, i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son of Hellen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; or <hi rend="ital">of Neptune</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 27</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14742.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n14742.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Doric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (architecturae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">symmetria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 34: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the Doric dialect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 59</bibl></cit> (al. <pos>adv.</pos> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrĭce</orth> dicta; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 56</bibl>: Dorice Rhodii loquuntur); hence, also: <itype>Dorici, ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those who speak Doric</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14742.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 32</bibl> (2, 8, b. 16, M.): <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:573" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agm. 611" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agm. 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ancon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14742.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrĭ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Doric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">moduli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phthongus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 20, § 84</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōri-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicen Dorium canebat bellicosum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14742.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrĭ-enses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Dorians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14742.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Doric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Malea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 81" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14742.7" n="b" level="4"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14742.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A country in Hellas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 13, § 28</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">in Asia Minor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:103 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 27, 29, § 103 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14742.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Oceanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Nereus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of fifty seanymphs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 25</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Hyg. Fab. praef.—Also,</quote> <trans><tr>wife of Dionysius I</tr>., <tr>Tyrant of Syracuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 13</bibl>, ext. 1.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the name of a Greek girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:7:72" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 7, 72</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:678" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 678</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 3, 2, 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14742.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> pseudoanchusa <hi rend="ital">and</hi> echis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 20, 24, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dorias: <entryFree id="n14743" type="main" key="Do_ri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*dwria/s</foreign>), <sense id="n14743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a character in the Eunuchus of Terence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:6:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 6, 32 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dorice: <entryFree id="n14744" type="main" key="Do_ri^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrĭce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the Doric manner</hi>, v. Dores, II. A.</sense></entryFree>
dorio: <entryFree id="n14745" type="main" key="Do_ri^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrĭō</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*dwri/wn</foreign>), <sense id="n14745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Dorio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a character in the Phormio of Terence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dorippa: <entryFree id="n14746" type="main" key="Do_rippa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrippa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dormio: <entryFree id="n14747" type="main" key="dormi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dormĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n14747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">futur.</hi> dormibo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 5, 5</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. R. drā-, drayami, I sleep; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">darqa/nw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to sleep</hi> (cf.: dormito, sopio, sterto). </sense><sense id="n14747.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: Quin tu is dormitum? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Dormio, ne occlamites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 27</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ire dormitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 119</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: dormitum dimittitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 73</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum dormitur in illo (lecto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:269" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 269</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnibus dormio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: proverbium videtur natum a Cipio quodam, qui Pararhenchon dictus est, quod simularet dormientem, quo impunitius uxor ejus moecharetur; <cit><quote lang="la">ejus meminit Lucilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=173:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 173, 5 sq.</bibl></cit> Müll.: in utramvis aurem dormire, v. auris, I.—</sense><sense id="n14747.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, of time, <hi rend="ital">to be slept through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spent in sleep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox est perpetua una dormienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota mihi dormitur hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:59" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14747.3" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., of the sleep of death: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si ego illum tractim tangam ut dormiat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 142</bibl>, and the preceding passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4760</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4808</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 6</bibl>, 18 al.—</sense><sense id="n14747.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Praegn.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormire cum aliquo, of sexual intercourse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:376" default="NO">376</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:19:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 19, 32</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14747.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14747.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be at ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vide ut dormiunt pessuli pessumi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6, 34</bibl> (4, 5, 34 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14747.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconcerned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem duxit ... et inde filiam Suscepit jam unam, dum tu dormis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; so Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 17</bibl>, and in eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to be careless</hi> in spiritual things, <hi rend="ital">unawakened</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 11, 30</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
dormisco: <entryFree id="n14748" type="main" key="dormisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dormisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [dormio], <hi rend="ital">to fall asleep</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 824</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
dormitatio: <entryFree id="n14749" type="main" key="dormi_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dormītātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dormito</etym>, <sense id="n14749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleep</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:131:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 131, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 23, 21</bibl>; Hil. in Psa. 118, 4, 7; Hier. in Naum, 3, 18 sq. <cb n="DOS" /></sense></entryFree>
dormitator: <entryFree id="n14750" type="main" key="dormi_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dormītātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sleeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggard</hi>, commonly understood of a thief, who sleeps by day and steals by night; but better, in gen., as <hi rend="ital">a dreamer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid fellow</hi>, only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 20</bibl>, and 142 Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
dormitio: <entryFree id="n14751" type="main" key="dormi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dormītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dormio</etym>, <sense id="n14751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sleeping</hi> (only ante- and post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 100, 1</bibl> and 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 11, 13</bibl>.—In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">death</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl>, Macc. 12, 45 al.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4461</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dormito: <entryFree id="n14752" type="main" key="dormi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dormīto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n14752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to be sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall asleep.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14752.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14752.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dormitante lucerna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>going out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 195</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14752.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be dreaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to linger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc diei tempus dormitasti in otio. Quin tu abs te socordiam omnem reice, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 139</bibl> Brix; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 359</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 24</bibl> Spald.; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 1, 22: oscitans et dormitans sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perditio eorum non dormitat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 3.</sense></entryFree>
dormitor: <entryFree id="n14753" type="hapax" key="dormi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dormītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sleeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dormitorius: <entryFree id="n14754" type="main" key="dormi_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dormītōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for sleeping</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">membrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dormitorium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sleeping-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dormitory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 6, 17, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
doron: <entryFree id="n14755" type="greek" key="do_ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dw=ron</foreign>, <sense id="n14755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gift</hi>, Lat. munus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dorso: <entryFree id="n14756" type="main" key="Dorso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dorso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 28 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dorsualis: <entryFree id="n14757" type="main" key="dorsu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dorsŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dorsum</etym>, <sense id="n14757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dorsal</hi> (post-class): <cit><quote lang="la">notae equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 266, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crustae ferarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, pinnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dorsualia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cover for the back</hi> of beasts, Trebell. Gallien. 8.</sense></entryFree>
dorsum: <entryFree id="n14758" type="main" key="dorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dorsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n14758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dorsus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 44</bibl>; quoted ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 203, 6</bibl>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">deirh/, de/rh</foreign>, neck], <hi rend="ital">the back</hi> (in class. prose, only of beasts of burden; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and later also of men; cf.: tergum, tergus). </sense><sense id="n14758.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., Plaut. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 86, § 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 21</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dorsus prurit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I begin to take</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14758.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things analogous in form or position: jugi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the ridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit of a hill</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apennini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerupti nemoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 91</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nemoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speluncae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the rock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 234</bibl></cit>; cf. of a <hi rend="ital">cliff</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 110</bibl>; 10, 303 Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <trans><tr>the raised part of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex dentalium,</quote> <trans><tr>the projecting irons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 172</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dorus: <entryFree id="n14759" type="main" key="Do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*dw=ros</foreign>). <sense id="n14759.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The legendary ancestor of the Dorians</hi>, v. Dores <hi rend="ital">init</hi> —</sense><sense id="n14759.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14759.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A character in the Eunuchus of Terence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
doryclus: <entryFree id="n14760" type="main" key="Do^ry_^clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏrȳ^clus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from Mount Tmarus in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Beroë</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 620</bibl>, and 647.</sense></entryFree>
dorycnion: <entryFree id="n14761" type="main" key="do^rycnion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŏrycnion</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">doru/knion</foreign>, <sense id="n14761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poisonous plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:74 al" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 21, § 74 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 191" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dorylaeum: <entryFree id="n14762" type="main" key="Do^ry^laeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏrylaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n14762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Phrygia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 119</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏrylenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏrylaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dorylas: <entryFree id="n14763" type="main" key="Do^ry^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏrylas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*doru/las</foreign>), <sense id="n14763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 380</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
doryphorus: <entryFree id="n14764" type="greek" key="Do^ry^pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dŏryphŏrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dorufo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n14764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lance-bearer</hi>, a statue by Polycletus, famous in ancient times, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:86:296" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 86, 296</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 21</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
