dorsennus: <entryFree id="n14765" type="main" key="dorsennus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dorsennus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dorsēnus</orth>, v. 1. dossenus.</entryFree>
dos: <entryFree id="n14766" type="main" key="do_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōs</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype> (<sense id="n14766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> dotium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:9:section=1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 9, § 1 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">dotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 9</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. do, like the Sicilian <foreign lang="greek">dwti/nh</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">dido/nai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=175" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 175</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a marriage portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dowry</hi> (for syn. cf.: donum, largitio, munus, donatio, etc.). </sense><sense id="n14766.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 11</bibl> <pb n="612" /> <cb n="DRAC" /> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 64 sq.</bibl> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 36</bibl> et saep.—Cf. on the legal regulations respecting the dos and the t. t. used in them (dotis datio, dictio, promissio, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3</bibl> tit.: <cit><quote lang="la">De jure dotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 15</bibl>: De dote cauta, non numerata; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11</bibl>: De dotis promissione et nuda pollicitatione; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 4</bibl> tit.: De dote praelegata; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 7</bibl>: De dotis collatione; cf. Rein's Privatr. p. 194 sq. —</sense><sense id="n14766.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a gift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endowment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quality</hi> (freq. since the Aug. per.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indoles, ingenium, facultates, virtutes): (juris civilis) artem verborum dote locupletasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinearum (pedamenta, vimina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae uvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis unionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 24, 50, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquatilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 717</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:562" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:583" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii (opp. bona corporis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 112</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis animique dotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae fortunaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes belli et togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: silvarum dotes, <hi rend="ital">the delights</hi>, i. e. the chase, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quoque carminibus meritas celebrare puellas Dos mea,</quote> <trans><tr>my gift</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix perii dotibus ipse meis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 2, 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dos erat ille (sc. Phaon) loci,</quote> <trans><tr>the ornament</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneritas in dote (est),</quote> <trans><tr>is highly prized</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dossennus: <entryFree id="n14767" type="main" key="dossennus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dossennus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dossēnus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dors-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dorsum, prop., <hi rend="ital">hunchback</hi>, hence</etym>, the standing character of a deceitful <sense id="n14767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soothsayer</hi> in the Atellanic comedies (like maccus, bucco, pappus), Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">514, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">516, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 6</bibl>; Fest. s. v. TEMETVM, p. 364 Müll.; cf. Munk, De Fabulis Atellanis, p. 35 sq. and p. 121; Ritschl, Parerga praef. p. 13.—</sense><sense id="n14767.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = scurra, <hi rend="ital">a fool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jester</hi>, ironically said of Plautus, as representing the characters of the parasites, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14768" type="main" key="Dossennus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dossennus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dossēnus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dors-</orth>), <sense id="n14768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 15, § 92</bibl>; id. ap. Indic. libr. 14 and 15.</sense></entryFree>
dossuarius: <entryFree id="n14769" type="main" key="dossu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dossŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dorsum</etym>, <sense id="n14769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that carries on its back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that bears burdens</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aselli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <trans><tr>beasts of burden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dotalis: <entryFree id="n14770" type="main" key="do_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dos</etym>, <sense id="n14770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a dowry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portion</hi> (of the wife, and sometimes of the husband), <hi rend="ital">dotal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 63</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 737</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 369</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 705</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:593" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 593</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:75" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 75</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
doto: <entryFree id="n14771" type="main" key="do_to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dōto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to endow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to portion</hi> (esp. richly); in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> rare (and perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">filiam splendidissime maritavit, dotavitque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine Trojano et Rutulo dotabere, virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 318</bibl></cit>; Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 290; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 648</bibl>.—And transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Arabia et olea dotatur lacrima,</quote> <trans><tr>is furnished with an exudation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 38, § 77</bibl></cit>; Pall. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> Insit. 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:30:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 30, 20</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dōtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">richly endowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gifted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provided.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14771.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 35</bibl> (1, 8, b. 9 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14771.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus vite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chione dotatissima formā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 301</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14772" type="main" key="Do_to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dōto</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dwtw/</foreign>, <sense id="n14772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-nymph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:134 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 134 al.</bibl>
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dra/kaina</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a shedragon</hi>, acc. to Don. p. 1747 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 643</bibl> and 684 ib.; Cledon. p. 1896 ib.</sense></entryFree>
drachma: <entryFree id="n14773" type="greek" key="drachma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drachma</orth> (old form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">drachŭma</orth>, <itype>like Alcumena, Aesculapius</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 40</bibl>), ae (<sense id="n14773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen plur.</hi> drachmūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=85" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 85</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">usually drachmarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; Cic. <cb n="DREP" /> Fl. 19, 43), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">draxmh/</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n14773.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small Greek coin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drachma</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drachm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of about the same value as the Roman</hi> denarius, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:84 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 84 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 43</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14773.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">a weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the eighth part of an</hi> uncia, <hi rend="ital">the half of a</hi> sicilicus, about the same as our <hi rend="ital">drachm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 34, 109, § 185</bibl>; Rhem. Fann. de Pond. 17 sq.</sense><sense id="n14773.3" n="1" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">drăco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> dracontis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 426, 2</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> dracontem, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 101</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dra/kwn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dragon</hi> (cf.: serpens, anguis, coluber, hydrus, vipera, aspis). </sense><sense id="n14773.4" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (those of the tame sort, esp. the Epidaurian, being kept as pets by luxurious Romans), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 22, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:67" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 20, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Sen. de Ira, 2, 31 al. —As the guardian of treasures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 20</bibl>; Fest. s. h. v. p. 67, 12 sq. Müll.—</sense><sense id="n14773.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14773.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a constellation</hi>, Cic. poëta N. D. 2, 42, 106 sq.—</sense><sense id="n14773.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cohort's standard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in templa referre dracones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:276" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 276</bibl></cit>; Treb. Poll. Gallien. 8; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14773.8" n="C" level="2"> Marinus, <hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 27, 43, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 6, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14773.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A water-vessel shaped like a serpent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14773.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An old vine-branch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:182" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 22, 35, § 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14773.11" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seafish</hi>, Trachinus Draco of Linn., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 27, 43, § 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14773.12" n="G" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">the Serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Devil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:12:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 12, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
draco: <entryFree id="n14774" type="main" key="Dra^co" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drăco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14774.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Athenian lawgiver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14774.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Actaeon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
draconarius: <entryFree id="n14775" type="main" key="dra^co_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>draco, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n14775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standard-bearer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
draconigena: <entryFree id="n14776" type="main" key="dra^co_ni^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcōnĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>dracogigno</etym>, <sense id="n14776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dragon-born</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thebes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:865" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 865</bibl></cit>: hostis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Alexander the Great</hi> (whom Olympias was said to have conceived by a serpent, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:11:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16:2" default="NO">12, 16, 2</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dracontarium: <entryFree id="n14777" type="main" key="dra^conta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcontārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>draco</etym>, <sense id="n14777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garland</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wreath twisted like a serpent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 15</bibl>; Inscr. Don. cl. 1, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 91.</sense></entryFree>
draconteus: <entryFree id="n14778" type="main" key="draconte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dracontĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent's</hi>: pedes, Mythogr. Lat. 1, 128; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dracontia: <entryFree id="n14779" type="greek" key="dra^conti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcontĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcontĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drakonti/as</foreign>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcōnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 57, § 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dracontion: <entryFree id="n14780" type="greek" key="dra^conti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcontĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drako/ntion</foreign>, <sense id="n14780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wheat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:64 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 64 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dracontios: <entryFree id="n14781" type="main" key="dra^conti^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcontĭos vītis</orth>, <sense id="n14781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excellent kind of vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dracontium: <entryFree id="n14782" type="greek" key="dra^conti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcontĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drako/ntion</foreign>, <sense id="n14782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dragon-wort</hi>, Arum dracunculus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 91, § 142</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also dracontia radix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 66, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dracunculus: <entryFree id="n14783" type="main" key="dra^cuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăcuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>draco</etym>. <sense id="n14783.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dragonet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14783.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A thread twisted like a serpent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1572</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14783.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dragonet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14783.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The plant tarragon</hi>, Artemisia dracunculus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 91, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dragantum: <entryFree id="n14784" type="main" key="dra^gantum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drăgantum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. tragacantha.</entryFree>
drama: <entryFree id="n14785" type="greek" key="dra_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drāma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dra=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n14785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drama</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 18, 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">drāmătĭ-cum</orth> poëma, <hi rend="ital">dramatic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 480</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
drancae: <entryFree id="n14786" type="main" key="Drancae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drancae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drangae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Persian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Bactrian tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:9" default="NO">8, 3, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dran-caeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drangaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Drancae</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:106" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:507" default="NO">507</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
drapeta: <entryFree id="n14787" type="greek" key="dra_pe^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drāpĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drape/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n14787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fugitive slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">runaway</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
draucus: <entryFree id="n14788" type="main" key="draucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">draucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sodomite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:27:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:96:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 96, 12</bibl>; cf.: draucus, <foreign lang="greek">katapu/gwn</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
draus: <entryFree id="n14789" type="main" key="Draus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Draus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dravus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the river Drave in Hungary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
drenso: <entryFree id="n14790" type="main" key="drenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drenso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, expresses the note of the swan, Auct. Philom. 23.</entryFree>
drepana: <entryFree id="n14791" type="main" key="Dre^pa^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drĕpăna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dre/pana</foreign>, <sense id="n14791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the western coast of Sicily</hi>, now <cb n="DRUS" /> <hi rend="ital">Trapani</hi>, Cato acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 707</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drĕpănum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 707</bibl>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drĕpăne</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">es</orth>), <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:269" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 269</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">The promontory in its neighborhood</hi> is called Promontorium Drepanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 88</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Drĕpănĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Drepanum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:57:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 57, § 140</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drĕpănĭtāni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the promontory of Drepanum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
drepanis: <entryFree id="n14792" type="greek" key="dre^pa^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drĕpănis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drepani/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the martin</hi>, Hirundo apus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 47, 101, § 257</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
drimyphagia: <entryFree id="n14793" type="greek" key="dri_my^pha^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drīmyphăgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drimufagi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n14793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the eating of acrid food</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:6:93" default="NO">2, 6, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
drindio: <entryFree id="n14794" type="main" key="drindi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drindĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, expresses the cry of the weasel, Auct. Philom. 61.</entryFree>
dromas: <entryFree id="n14795" type="greek" key="dro^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drŏmas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">droma/s</foreign>. <sense id="n14795.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dromedary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 28</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">drŏmĕdārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Hier. Vit. Malchi, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 60, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14795.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drŏmas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of one of Actaeon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dromo: <entryFree id="n14796" type="main" key="dro^mo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drŏmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dro/mwn</foreign> (the runner). <sense id="n14796.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of shell-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14796.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of vessel rapidly propelled by many oars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cutter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14797" type="main" key="Dro^mo_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drŏmō</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*dro/mwn</foreign>, <sense id="n14797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dromos: <entryFree id="n14798" type="greek" key="dro^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drŏmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dro/mos</foreign>. <sense id="n14798.0" n="I" level="1"> A place for running; <hi rend="ital">a race-course</hi>, Grut. Inscr. 339, 2.—</sense><sense id="n14798.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., as <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drŏmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the plain near Sparta</hi>, on which the Lacedaemonian youth exercised, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 27, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14798.2" n="2" level="3"> Dromos Achilleos, <hi rend="ital">a peninsula west of the Crimea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which Achilles was said to have run a race</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dropacator: <entryFree id="n14799" type="gloss" key="dro_pa^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drōpăcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">drōpăci-sta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who depilates</hi>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
dropacismus: <entryFree id="n14800" type="greek" key="dro_pa^cismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drōpăcismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drwpakismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the removal of hair by plasters of pitch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:6:93" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 6, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dropaco: <entryFree id="n14801" type="main" key="dro_pa^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drōpăco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to depilate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dropax: <entryFree id="n14802" type="greek" key="dro_pax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drōpax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drw/pac</foreign>, <sense id="n14802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pitchointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depilatory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:74" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:65:8" default="NO">10, 65, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:36 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 36 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
drosolithus: <entryFree id="n14803" type="main" key="dro^so^li^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drŏsŏlĭthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">droso/liqos</foreign>, <sense id="n14803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dewstone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone now unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
druentia: <entryFree id="n14804" type="main" key="Dru^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drŭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tributary river of the Rhodanus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Durance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:468" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 468</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 479</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
druides: <entryFree id="n14805" type="main" key="Dru^i^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drŭĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Drŭĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 451</bibl>.—Dub. form <case>acc.</case> Druidas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 4, § 13</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Druids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the priests and wise men of the Gauls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 95, § 249</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n14805.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drŭïas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Gallic priestess and prophetess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Druidess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 60</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drŭis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2200</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 44</bibl>; Numer. 15.</sense></entryFree>
drungus: <entryFree id="n14806" type="foreign" key="drungus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">drungus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a body of soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a troop</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
druppa: <entryFree id="n14807" type="greek" key="druppa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">druppa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">drūpa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sc.</orth>) oliva = <foreign lang="greek">dru/ppa</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">drupeph/s</foreign>), <sense id="n14807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an over-ripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkled olive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <itype>drupa, ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 7</bibl> 7, § 26; 17, 24, 37, § 230; 19, 5, 26, § 78.</sense></entryFree>
drusus: <entryFree id="n14808" type="main" key="Dru_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drūsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a well-known Roman surname in the Livian family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first assumed by the Livius who slew the Gallic general</hi> Drausus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 3</bibl>.—Esp. </sense><sense id="n14808.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">M. Livius Drusus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncle of Cato Uticensis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murdered by Q. Varius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14808.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Claudius Drusus Nero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Tib. Claudius Nero and Livia Drusilla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Germanicus</hi>, the theme of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 33</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drūsĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Drūsīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossae,</quote> <trans><tr>a canal on the Lower Rhine</tr>, <tr>constructed by Drusus</tr>, <tr>the son of Livia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Drūsilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of</hi> <pb n="613" /> <cb n="DUBI" /> <hi rend="ital">several females of the Livian family.</hi>— Esp. </sense><sense id="n14808.3" n="1" level="3"> Livia Drusilla, <hi rend="ital">the second wife of Augustus</hi>, v. Livius.—</sense><sense id="n14808.4" n="2" level="3"> Drusilla, <hi rend="ital">daughter of</hi> Drusus Germanicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dryades: <entryFree id="n14809" type="main" key="Dry^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dryădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (<sense id="n14809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. Graec.</hi> dryasin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 12</bibl>; dub. al. adryasin; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:32" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 32</bibl> and 34), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*drua/des</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">wood-nymphs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dryads</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 507</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 453 al.</bibl>—In the <number>sing.</number>, Dryas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:62" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dryas: <entryFree id="n14810" type="main" key="Dry^as1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dryas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dru/as</foreign>. <sense id="n14810.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of Lycurgus king of Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 132" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dryantīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Lycurgus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:347" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 347</bibl>; cf. Hyg. and <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.—</sense><sense id="n14810.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithae</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:290 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 290 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14810.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sharer in the Calydonican hunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 307</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14811" type="main" key="Dry^as2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dryas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. Dryades <sense id="n14811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dryitis: <entryFree id="n14812" type="greek" key="dry^i_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dryītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">drui=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n14812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
drymo: <entryFree id="n14813" type="main" key="Dry_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drȳmo</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*drumw/</foreign>, <sense id="n14813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-nymph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 336</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
dryope: <entryFree id="n14814" type="main" key="Dry^o^pe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dryŏpe</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*druo/ph</foreign>. <sense id="n14814.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of Amphissus by Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 331</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">364</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n14814.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of Tarquitus by Faunus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 551</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dryophonon: <entryFree id="n14815" type="greek" key="dry^o^pho^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dryŏphŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">druo/fonon</foreign>, <sense id="n14815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of fern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 49, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dryops: <entryFree id="n14816" type="main" key="Dry^ops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dryops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n14816.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Dryopes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:490" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 490</bibl>; usu. <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dryŏpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Dryopians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4 praef.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 146</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14816.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 346</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dryopteris: <entryFree id="n14817" type="greek" key="dry^opte^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dryoptĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">druopteri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant similar to the preceding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 48, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
drysidae: <entryFree id="n14818" type="main" key="Dry^si^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Drysĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Druids</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dua: <entryFree id="n14819" type="main" key="dua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dua</orth>, v. duo.</entryFree>
dualis: <entryFree id="n14820" type="main" key="du^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>duo</etym>, <sense id="n14820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that contains two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus (nasi),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the dual number</tr>, <tr>duality</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—In gram. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>the dual</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:42 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 42 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dualitas: <entryFree id="n14821" type="main" key="du^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number two</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dubenus: <entryFree id="n14822" type="gloss" key="dubenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dubenus</orth> <itype>apud antiquos dicebatur qui nunc dominus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=67:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 67, 7</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
dubie: <entryFree id="n14823" type="main" key="du^bi^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭbĭe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubtfully</hi>, v. dubius <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dubietas: <entryFree id="n14824" type="main" key="du^bi^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭbĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dubius</etym>, <sense id="n14824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertainty</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dubiosus: <entryFree id="n14825" type="main" key="du^bi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭbĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dubious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (with inexplicabile),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dubis: <entryFree id="n14826" type="main" key="Du_bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dūbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dou=bis</foreign>, <sense id="n14826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in</hi> Gallia Belgica, now <hi rend="ital">Doubs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dubitabilis: <entryFree id="n14827" type="main" key="du^bi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭbĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dubito</etym>, <sense id="n14827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n14827.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be doubted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14827.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeling doubt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 649</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dubitanter: <entryFree id="n14828" type="main" key="du^bi^tanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭbĭtanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubtingly</hi>, v. dubito <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
dubitatim: <entryFree id="n14829" type="main" key="du^bi^ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭbĭtātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hesitatingly</hi>, v. dubito <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
dubitatio: <entryFree id="n14830" type="main" key="du^bi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭbĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dubito</etym>. <sense id="n14830.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wavering in opinion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judgment; a being uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a doubting; uncertainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14830.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n14830.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (freq. and good prose). </sense><sense id="n14830.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi sollicitudinem ex dubitatione mea, nec spem ex affirmatione, afferre volui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res non conjecturā, sed oculis ac manibus teneretur, neque in causa ulla dubitatio posset esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cluent. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea obscuritate ac dubitatione omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quamquam dubitationem non habet, tamen rationes afferendas puto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitationem afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 147</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo sibi minus dubitationis dari, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tollendam dubitationem sola non sufficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al. So in Cicero a few times: sine ulla dubitatione, <hi rend="ital">without any doubt</hi>, i. e. per litoten, <hi rend="ital">most certainly</hi> (an emphatic sine dubio, v. dubius, I. B. 2. b. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so too, sine dubitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit> (but far more freq. in signif. II., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>).—</sense><sense id="n14830.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: omnem<cb n="DUBI" />  dubitationem adventus legionum expellere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">juris (i. e. dubitatio, penes quem esset jus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:31:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 31, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus utilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14830.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Socratica, de omnibus rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Afr. 26.—</sense><sense id="n14830.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interrog. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando dubitatio accidit, quale sit id, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cluent. 28, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum potest habere dubitationem, adhibendumne fuerit hoc genus ... an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 44</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic locus nihil habeat dubitationis, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With a <hi rend="ital">subject acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc a rustico factum extra dubitationem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14830.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., as a fig. of speech, i. q. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diapo/rhsis</foreign>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hesitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embarrassment</hi> of the speaker, because unable to do justice to the greatness of his theme (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:56:section=214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 56, § 214</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 29, 40</bibl>; cf. Ernest. Lex. Technol. Lat. p. 136.—</sense><sense id="n14830.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (dubito, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">a doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigna dubitatio homine!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad rem publicam adeundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14830.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitating in coming to a conclusion; hesitancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irresolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestuabat dubitatione, versabat se in utramque partem non solum mente, verum etiam corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui timor! quae dubitatio! quanta haesitatio tractusque verborum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter dubitationem et moras senati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 30, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 62, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aluit dubitatione bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) nulla interposita dubitatione legiones ex castris educit,</quote> <trans><tr>without any hesitation</tr>, <tr>promptly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in this signif. very freq. in Cicero: sine ulla dubitatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cluent. 28, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>, b. 2. et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">absque ulla dubitatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">less freq. merely sine dubitatione,</quote> <trans><tr>without hesitation</tr>, <tr>unhesitatingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 16, 3</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fil. Fam. 16, 21</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 63, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 10, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
